column1: This chain letter was started in hopes of bringing relief to other tired and discouraged men. Unlike most chain letters
column2:
this one does not cost anything.
Just send a copy of this letter to five of your friends who are equally tired and discontented. Then bundle up your wife or girlfriend and send her to the man whose name appears at the top of the following list and add your name to the bottom of the list.

\n

When your turn comes
column3: you will receive 15
column4: 625 women. One of them is bound to be better than the one you already have. At the writing of this letter
column5: a friend of mine had already received 184 women
column6:
of whom 4 were worth keeping.

\n

REMEMBER this chain brings luck. One man''s pit bull died and the next day he received a Playboy swimsuit model. An unmarried man living with his widowed mother was able to choose between a Hooters waitress and a Hollywood super model.

\n

You can be lucky too
column7:
but DO NOT BREAK THE CHAIN! One man broke the chain and got his own wife back again.

\n

Let''s keep it going
column8:
men! Just add your name to the list below!

\n

> Bill Clinton
> 1600 Pennsylvania Ave
> Washington DC

column1: Two lawyers are walking on the beach. A lovely blond woman in a skimpy bikini walks by.Lawyer #1 says
column2: "Boy
column3: wouldn''t you like to screw her?"Lawyer #2 then asks
column4: "Screw her out of what?"

column1: I never have quite figured out why the sexual urges of men & women differ so much. And I never have figured out the whole Mars & Venus thing. And
column2: I never have figured out why men think with their head and women with their heart. And
column3: I never yet have figured out how the sexual desire gene gets thrown into a state of turmoil
column4:
when it hears the words "I do".

\n

One evening last week
column5: my wife and I were getting into bed. Well
column6: the passion starts to heat up
column7: and she eventually says
column8: "I don''t feel like it
column9:
I just want you to hold me."

\n

I said
column10: "WHAT??" So she says the words that I and every husband on the planet dreads. She explains that I must not be in tune with her emotional needs as a Woman. I''m thinking
column11:
"What was her first clue?"

\n

I finally realize that nothing is going to happen that night
column12: so I went to bed. The very next day we went shopping at a big unnamed department store... I walked around while she tried on three very expensive outfits. She couldn''t decide which one to take
column13:
so I told her to take all three of them.

\n

She then tells me that she wants matching shoes worth $200 each to which I say OK. And then we go to the Jewelry Dept. where she gets a set of diamond earrings. Let me tell you ...she was so excited. She must have thought that I was one wave short of a shipwreck
column14:
but I don''t think she cared. I think she was testing me when she asked for a tennis bracelet because she doesn''t even play tennis. I think I threw her for a loop when I told her that it was OK.

\n

She was almost sexually excited from all of this and you should have seen her face when she said
column15: "I''m ready to go
column16:
let''s go to the cash register."

\n

I could hardly contain myself when I blurted out
column17: "No
column18: honey. I don''t feel like buying all this stuff now." You should have seen her face ... it went completely blank. I then said
column19:
"Really honey! I just want you to HOLD this stuff for a while."

\n

And just when she had this look like she was going to kill me
column20: I added
column21:
"You must not be in tune with my financial needs as a Man."

\n

I figure that I should be having sex again sometime during the Spring thaw.

column1:
One day this Preacher decided that he would skip church and go hunting. When
in the woods he came upon a bear. He started running
column2:
and he ran for a while
until all of a sudden he tripped over a tree root. At this moment he was almost
face to face with the bear. He dropped to his knees and said
column3: "Dear Lord
column4:
if
there is one wish I would want for you to give me it would be to make this bear
a Christian." And at that instant�酶惟the bear halted to a stop and dropped to his
knees and said
column5: "Dear Lord
column6: thank you for the food I am about to receive!"

column1:
Some things I''ve learned from my children:

Super glue "is" forever.

No matter how much Jell-O you put in a swimming pool you still can''t walk on water. Pool filters "do not like Jell-O!"

A king size waterbed holds enough water to fill a 2000 sq. foot house 4 inches deep.

Garbage bags do not make good parachutes.

Marbles in gas tanks make lots of noise when driving.

If you hook a dog leash over a ceiling fan
column2:
the motor is not strong enough to rotate a 42 pound boy wearing Batman underwear and a superman cape. It is strong enough however to spread paint on all four walls of 20 by 20 foot room.

\n

You should not throw baseballs up when the ceiling fan is on. When using the ceiling fan as a bat
column3:
you have to throw the ball up a few times before you get a hit. A ceiling fan can hit a baseball a long way. And the glass in windows (even double pane) doesn''t stop a
baseball hit by a ceiling fan.

\n

Certain Legos will pass through the digestive tract of a four year old.

\n

VCR''s do not eject peanut butter and jelly sandwiches
column4:
even though TV commercials show they do.

\n

Always look in the oven before you turn it on. It''s been proven that plastic toys do not like ovens.
Play Dough and Microwave should never be used in the same sentence.

\n

If you spray hair spray on dust bunnies and run over them with roller blades
column5:
they can ignite.

\n

The spin cycle on the washing machine does not make earth worms dizzy. It will however make cats dizzy. Cats throw up twice their body weight when dizzy.

column1:
To the citizens of the United States of America:

\n

In light of your failure to elect a President of the USA and thus to govern yourselves
column2: we hereby give notice of the revocation of your independence
column3:
effective today.

\n

Her Sovereign Majesty Queen Elizabeth II will resume monarchial duties over all states
column4: commonwealths and other territories. Except Utah
column5: which she does not fancy. Your new prime minister (The Rt. Hon. Tony Blair
column6:
MP for the 97.85% of you who have until now been unaware that there is a world outside your borders) will appoint a minister for America without the need for further elections. Congress and the Senate will be disbanded. A questionnaire will be circulated next year to determine whether any of you noticed.

\n

To aid in the transition to a British Crown Dependency
column7:
the following rules are introduced with immediate effect:

\n

1. You should look up "revocation" in the Oxford English Dictionary.
Then look up "aluminium" . Check the pronunciation guide. You will be amazed at just how wrongly you have been pronouncing it. Generally
column8:
you should raise your vocabulary to acceptable levels.

Look up "vocabulary". Using the same twenty seven words interspersed with filler noises such as "like" and "you know" is an unacceptable and inefficient form of communication. Look up "interspersed".

2. There is no such thing as "US English". We will let Microsoft know on your behalf.

3. You should learn to distinguish the English and Australian accents. It really isn''t that hard.

4. Hollywood will be required occasionally to cast English actors as the good guys.

5. You should relearn your original national anthem
column9: God Save The Queen
column10:
but only after fully carrying out task 1. We would not want you to get confused and give up half way through.

\n

6. You should stop playing American football. There is only one kind of football. What you refer to as American football is not a very good game. The 2.15% of you who are aware that there is a world outside your borders may have noticed that no one else plays American" football. You will no longer be allowed to play it
column11:
and should instead play proper football.

\n

Initially
column12: it would be best if you played with the girls. It is a difficult game. Those of you brave enough will
column13: in time
column14: be allowed to play rugby (which is similar to American football
column15:
but does not involve stopping for a rest every twenty seconds or wearing full kevlar body armour like nancies). We are hoping to get together at least a US rugby sevens side by 2005.

\n

7. You should declare war on Quebec and France
column16:
using nuclear weapons if they give you any merde. The 98.85% of you who were not aware that there is a world outside your borders should count yourselves lucky. The Russians have never been the bad guys. Merde is French for "shit"

\n

8. July 4th is no longer a public holiday. November 8th will be a new national holiday
column17:
but only in England. It will be called Indecisive Day.

\n

9. All American cars are hereby banned. They are crap and it is for your own good. When we show you German cars
column18:
you will understand what we mean.

\n

10. Please tell us who killed JFK. It''s been driving us crazy.

\n

Thank you for your cooperation.

column1:
This was actually an essay written by a college applicant
applying to colleges/universities. The author of this essay
column2: Hugh Gallagher
column3:
now attends NYU

\n

ESSAY IN ORDER FOR THE ADMISSIONS STAFF OF OUR COLLEGE TO GET TO
KNOW YOU
column4: THE APPLICANT
column5: BETTER
column6:
WE ASK THAT YOU ANSWER THE
FOLLOWING QUESTION: ARE THERE ANY SIGNIFICANT EXPERIENCES YOU
HAVE HAD
column7: OR ACCOMPLISHMENTS YOU HAVE REALIZED
column8:
THAT HAVE HELPED
TO DEFINE YOU AS A PERSON?

\n

I am a dynamic figure
column9:
often seen scaling walls and crushing
ice. I have been known to remodel train stations on my lunch
breaks
column10:
making them more efficient in the area of heat
retention. I translate ethnic slurs for Cuban refugees
column11:
I write
award-winning operas
column12: I manage time efficiently. Occasionally
column13:
I
tread water for three days in a row. I woo women with my
sensuous and godlike trombone playing.

\n

I can pilot bicycles up severe inclines with unflagging speed
column14:
and I cook Thirty-Minute Brownies in twenty minutes. I am an
expert in stucco
column15: a veteran in love
column16:
and an outlaw in Peru.
Using only a hoe and a large glass of water
column17:
I once
single-handedly defended a small village in the Amazon Basin
from a horde of ferocious army ants. I play bluegrass cello
column18:
I
was scouted by the Mets
column19:
I am the subject of numerous
documentaries. When I''m bored
column20:
I build large suspension bridges
in my yard. I enjoy urban hang gliding. On Wednesdays
column21:
after
school
column22:
I repair electrical appliances free of charge. I am an
abstract artist
column23: a concrete analyst
column24:
and a ruthless bookie.
Critics worldwide swoon over my original line of corduroy
evening wear. I don''t perspire. I am a private citizen
column25:
yet I
receive fan mail. I have been caller number nine and have won
the weekend passes. Last summer I toured New Jersey with a
traveling centrifugal-force demonstration. I bat .400. My deft
floral arrangements have earned me fame in international botany
circles.

\n

Children trust me. I can hurl tennis rackets at small moving
objects with deadly accuracy. I once read Paradise Lost
column26:
Moby
Dick
column27:
and David Copperfield in one day and still had time to
refurbish an entire dining room that evening. I know the exact
location of every food item in the supermarket. I have performed
several covert operations for the CIA. I sleep once a week; when
I do sleep
column28: I sleep in a chair. While on vacation in Canada
column29:
I
successfully negotiated with a group of terrorists who had
seized a small bakery. The laws of physics do not apply to me. I
balance
column30: I weave
column31: I dodge
column32: I frolic
column33:
and my bills are all paid.
On weekends
column34: to let off steam
column35:
I participate in full-contact
origami. Years ago I discovered the meaning of life but forgot
to write it down. I have made extraordinary four course meals
using only a mouli and a toaster oven. I breed prizewinning
clams. I have won bullfights in San Juan
column36:
cliff-diving
competitions in Sri Lanka
column37:
and spelling bees at the Kremlin. I
have played Hamlet
column38: I have performed open-heart surgery
column39:
and I
have spoken with Elvis. But I have not yet gone to college.

\n

Can you believe this???

column1: It is the Olympic men''s figure skating. Out comes the Russian competitor
column2:
he
skates around to some classical music in a slightly dull costume
column3:
performs some
excellent leaps but without any great artistic feel for the music.

\n

The Judges'' scores read: Britain 5.8: Russia 5.9: United States 5.5: Ireland
6.0

\n

Next comes the American competitor in a sparkling stars and stripes costume
column4: skating to some rock and roll music. He gets the crowd clapping
column5:
but is not
technically as good as the Russian. He slightly misses landing a triple Salchow
and loses the center during a spin. But
column6: artistically
column7:
it is a more satisfying
performance.

\n

The Judges'' scores read: Britain 5.8: Russia 5.5: United States 5.9: Ireland
6.0

\n

Finally out comes the Irish competitor wearing a tatty old donkey jacket
column8:
with
his skates tied over his wellies. He reaches the ice
column9:
trips straight away and
bangs his nose which starts bleeding. He tries to get up
column10:
staggers a few paces
then slips again. He spends his entire ''routine'' getting up then falling over
again. Finally he crawls off the ice a tattered and bleeding mess.

\n

The Judges'' scores read: Britain 0.0: Russia 0.0: United States 0.0: Ireland
6.0

\n

The other 3 judges turn to the Irish judge and demand in unison
column11:
"How the hell
can you give that mess 6.0?!"

\n

To which the Irish judge replies "You''ve gotta remember
column12:
it''s damn slippery
out there."

column1:
A young blonde was on vacation in the depths of Louisiana. She wanted a pair
of genuine alligator shoes in the worst way
column2:
but was very reluctant to pay the
high prices the local vendors were asking.
After becoming very frustrated with the "no haggle" attitude of one of the
shopkeepers
column3: the blonde shouted
column4:
"Maybe I''ll just go out and catch my own
alligator so I can get a pair of shoes at a reasonable price!"
The shopkeeper said
column5: "By all means
column6:
be my guest. Maybe you''ll luck out and
catch yourself a big one!" Determined
column7:
the blonde turned and headed for the
swamps
column8:
set on catching herself an alligator.
Later in the day
column9: the shopkeeper was driving home
column10:
when he spotted the young
woman standing waist deep in the water
column11: shotgun in hand. Just then
column12:
he saw a
huge 9-foot alligator swimming quickly toward her. She took aim
column13:
killed the
creature
column14:
and with a great deal of effort hauled it on to the swamp bank. Lying
nearby were several more of the dead creatures. The shopkeeper watched in
amazement. Just then the blonde flipped the alligator on its back
column15:
and
frustrated
column16: shouts out
column17: "Damn it
column18: this one isn''t wearing any shoes either!"

column1: One day
column2:
farmer Williams was in town picking up supplies for his farm.

\n

He stopped at the hardware store and picked up a bucket and an anvil. Then he stopped by the livestock dealer to buy a couple of chickens and a goose.

\n

However
column3: he now had a problem
column4:
how to carry all his purchases home.

\n

The livestock dealer said: "Why don''t you put the anvil in the bucket
column5: carry the bucket in one hand
column6:
put a chicken under each arm and carry the goose in your other hand?"

"Hey thanks!" the farmer said and off he went. While walking he met a little old lady who told him she was lost.

She asked: "Can you tell me how to get to 123 Township Road?"

The farmer said: "Well
column7: as a matter of fact
column8:
I live at 132 Township Road. Let''s take my shortcut and go down this alley; we''ll be there in no time."

\n

The little old lady said: "How do I know that when we get in the alley
column9: you won''t hold me up against the wall
column10: pull up my skirt
column11:
and ravish me?"

\n

The farmer said: "Holy smokes lady
column12: I am carrying a bucket
column13: an anvil
column14: two chickens
column15:
and a goose. How in the world could I possibly hold you up against the wall and do that?"

\n

The lady said: "Set the goose down
column16: cover him with the bucket
column17:
put the anvil on top of the bucket and I''ll hold the chickens...."

\n

Submitted by calamjo
Editted by curtis

Texas executes last remaining citizen.

Average height of NBA players now nine feet

seven inches.

Microsoft announces it has perfected its newest version of Windows so it crashes BEFORE installation is completed.

column1:
Customer: "Your sound card is defective and I want a new one."
Tech Support: "What seems to be the problem?"
Customer: "The balance is backwards. The left channel is coming out of the right speaker and the right channel is coming out the left.
It''s defective!"
Tech Support: "You can solve the problem by moving the left speaker to the right side of the machine and vice versa."
Customer: (sputter) (click)
Tech Support: (snicker)

\n

****************

\n

I had been doing Tech Support for Hewlett-Packard''s DeskJet division for about a month when I had a customer call with a problem I just couldn''t solve. She could not print yellow. All the other colors would print fine
column2: which truly baffled me because the only true colors are cyan
column3: magenta
column4: and yellow. For instance
column5: green is a combination of cyan and yellow
column6:
but green printed fine.

\n

Every color of the rainbow printed fine except for yellow. I had the customer change ink cartridges. I had the customer delete and reinstall the drivers. Nothing worked. I asked my co-workers for help; they offered no new ideas.

\n

After over two hours of troubleshooting
column7: I was about to tell the customer to send the printer in to us for repair when she asked quietly
column8:
"Should I try printing on a piece of white paper instead of this "yellow" construction paper?"

*******************

A man attempting to set up his new printer called the printer''s tech support number
column9:
complaining about the error message: "Can''t find the printer."

\n

On the phone
column10: the man said he even held the printer up in front of the screen
column11:
but the computer still couldn''t find it! (YEE-HAW!)

\n

*****************

\n

Customer: "Hello? I''m trying to dial in. I installed the software okay
column12: and it dialed fine. I could hear that. Then I could hear the two computers connecting. But then the sound all stopped
column13: so I picked up the phone to see if they were still connected
column14: and I got the message
column15: ''No Carrier
column16:
'' on my screen. What''s wrong?"

*****************

An unfailingly polite lady called to ask for help with a Windows installation that had gone terribly wrong.

Customer: "I brought my Windows disks from work to install them on my
home computer." (Training stresses that we are "not the Soft-ware Police
column17:
so I let the little act of piracy slide.)
Tech Support: Umm-hmm. What happened?"
Customer: "As I put each disk in it turns out they weren''t initialized."

\n

Tech Support: "Do you remember the message exactly
column18:
ma''am?"
Customer:(proudly) "I wrote it down. ''This is not a Macintosh disk. Would you like to initialize it''?"
Tech Support: "Er
column19:
what happened next?"
Customer: "After they were initialized all the disks appeared to be blank. And now I brought them back to work
column20:
and I can''t read them in the A: drive; the PC wants to format them. And this is our only set of Windows disks for the whole office. Did I do something wrong?"

\n

******************

\n

For a computer programming class
column21: I sat directly across from someone
column22:
and our computers were facing away from each other.

\n

A few minutes into the class
column23:
she got up to leave the room. I reached between our computers and switched the inputs for the keyboards. She came back and started typing and immediately got a distressed look on her face.

\n

She called the teacher over and explained that no matter what she typed
column24:
nothing would happen. The teacher tried everything. By this time I was hiding behind my monitor and quaking red-faced.

\n

I started to type
column25:
"Leave me alone!"

\n

They both jumped back
column26:
silenced. "What the . . . " the teacher said.
I typed
column27:
"I said leave me alone!"

\n

The kid got real upset. "I didn''t do anything to it
column28:
I swear!"
It was all I could do to keep from laughing out loud. The conversation between them and HAL 2000 went on for an amazing five minutes.

\n

Me: "Don''t touch me!"

\n

Her: "I''m sorry
column29:
I didn''t mean to hit your keys that hard."

\n

Me: "Who do you think you are anyway?!" Etc. Finally
column30:
I couldn''t contain myself any longer and fell out of my chair laughing.

\n

After they had realized what I had done
column31: they both turned beet red. Funny
column32:
I never got more than a C- in that class.

\n

***************

\n

I have a friend who just bought a computer and was instructed to load a program by typing "A:" and then the name of the program. My friend told me it would not work because his keyboard was no good. He said he couldn''t type the "dot over dot thingie" and that every time he tried to type the "dot over dot thingie" he kept getting the "dot over comma thingie" no matter how careful he was to press only on the very top of
the key.
When I taught him about the shift key
column33:
he thought I was a genius.

\n

*****************

\n

This guy calls in to complain that he gets an "Access Denied" message every time he logs in. It turned out he was typing his user name and password in capital letters.
Tech Support: "OK
column34: let''s try once more
column35: but use lower case letters." Customer: "Uh
column36:
I only have capital letters on my keyboard."

****************

Email from a friend: "CanYouFixTheSpaceBarOnMyKeyboard?"

****************

My friend was on duty in the main lab on a quiet afternoon. He noticed a young woman sitting in front of one of the workstations with her arms crossed across her chest and staring at the screen. After about 15 minutes he noticed that she was still in the same position only now she was impatiently tapping her foot. He asked if she needed help and she replied
column37:
"It''s about time! I pushed the F1 button over twenty minutes ago!"

I will not carve gods.

Mud is not one of the 4 food groups.

column1: Dave works hard at the plant and spends most evenings bowling or playing basketball at the gym. His wife thinks he is pushing himself too hard
column2: so for his birthday she takes him to a local strip club. The doorman at the club greets them and says
column3: "Hey
column4: Dave
column5:
how ya doin''?"

\n

His wife is puzzled and asks if he''s been to this club before.

\n

"Oh no
column6:
says Dave. He''s on my bowling team."

\n

When they are seated
column7: a waitress asks Dave if he''d like his usual Budweiser. His wife is becoming uncomfortable and says
column8:
"You must come here a lot for that woman to know you drink Budweiser."

\n

"No
column9: honey
column10:
she''s in the Ladies Bowling League. We share lanes with them."

\n

A stripper comes over to their table and throws her arms around Dave. "Hi Davey
column11:
she says, Want your usual table dance?"

\n

Dave''s wife
column12: now furious
column13: grabs her purse and storms out of the club. Dave follows and spots her getting into a cab. Before she can slam the door
column14:
he jumps in beside her and she starts screaming at him.

\n

The cabby turns his head and says
column15: "Looks like you picked up a real bitch tonight
column16: Dave."

column1:
Bob and Earl were best friends and had been for 50 years. They went to baseball games together and had the best time possible.

They truly loved the game but they always wondered if there was baseball in heaven and agreed that whoever died first had to call the other guy and tell them if there was baseball in heaven.

Then one night Earl died and then a few days later Bob went to his funeral and came home after the burial service.

Then the phone rang it was Earl.
Earl said
column2:
Bob is this you
Bob said
column3:
Yes, Earl how are you doing and is there baseball in heaven?

\n

Earl said
column4:
Well I''ve got some good news and some bad news.
Bob said
column5:
"Whats the good news?"

\n

Earl said
column6:
"Well there is baseball in heaven and you can play with Babe Ruth and everybody its great"

\n

Bob said
column7:
"Then what''s the bad news?"

\n

Earl said
column8: "Well Bob
column9: your starting pitching tommorow night!"

column1: After a two year long study
column2:
the National Science Foundation announced the following results on corporate America''s recreation preferences.

1. The sport of choice for unemployed or incarcerated people is:
Basketball.

2. The sport of choice for maintenance level employees is:
Bowling.

3. The sport of choice for front line workers is:
Football.

4. The sport of choice for supervisors is:
Baseball.

5. The sport of choice for middle management is:
Tennis.

6. The sport of choice for corporate officers is:
Golf.

Conclusion: The higher you are in the corporate structure
column3: the smaller your balls become!

column1:
Does this ring true to you? Maybe you have to be from North
Jersey for some of these... You know you''re from Jersey
when......

\n

- You refer to the beach as the shore.

\n

- You know what a Wawa is
column2:
and you know the location of at least
5 of them.

- You don''t understand why there aren''t more 24-hour diners
elsewhere in the country.

- You can name all the flavors of salt water taffy.

- You''ve run out of money on the Parkway.

- You still haven''t seen that many gardens.

- You still can''t believe MTV went to Seaside Heights.

- There are no self-serve gas stations.

- You know what a "jug handle" is.

- You only go to the "City" for day trips.

- Route 18 doesn''t freak you out at night.

- You believe the Statue of Liberty is in NJ.

- You don''t take any shit from anybody especially people from
New York and Philly
column3:
because you live here for Christ''s sake and
just who the hell do they think they are anyway? Invading our
beaches and bars
column4:
they are just here for the damn summer and
they think they own the place.

- At least three people in your family still listen to Bruce
"The Boss" Springsteen and actually seen him play with the
E-Street band in the Stone Pony down in Asbury.

- You know Paramus has 4 major malls within 3 miles of each
other.

- You have mandatory recycling enforced by law.

- You''ve pondered
column5:
"Maybe basketball would be more popular in NJ
if the Nets didn''t suck."

\n

- You have nearly been run over by a TramCar in Wildwood.

\n

- You have a grandparent who didn''t move to Florida and retired
in Cape May
column6: Ocean Grove
column7: Brick
column8:
or Toms River.

- Donald Trump is mentioned daily in your local newspaper.

- Your school actually made good Italian subs.

- The Jets/Giants game has started fights in your family.

- You have been waiting the last 10 years for the Yankees to
move to the Meadowlands.

- You own an annual pass to Great Adventure and you had to take
the monkey by-pass at the Safari cause your dad had padded-vinyl
roof on his car.

- You say "water" weird.

- Your car is covered in yellow-green dust in April.

- You know that ACME is a supermarket
column9:
not just a Warner Bros
creation.

\n

- Because your town was founded before 1776
column10: all restaurants
column11: bars and shops have ''ye''
column12: ''olde''
column13:
or ''colonial'' in their names.

- You know the myth of the New Jersey devil and you think it
lives as Gov. Christie Todd Whitman. (Whitman IS the devil.)

- You think the Olive Garden is crap and should never have
opened in NJ.

- You remember when Hoboken was a ghetto not overpriced.

- There is a fruit and veggie stand down the road.

- You like vinegar or gravy on your french fries.

- You think a mountain is that big freakin'' hill in Atlantic
Highlands.

- You know Asbury Park is no longer the Mecca of East Coast
resort towns.

- Even though there''s a new Wal-Mart in your town

column20: "Outside when you said you heard someone coming -- that was me."

column1:
What the world is like in TV land:

1. If a woman is running away from someone she will trip and fall.

2. Your car will always start immediately unless you are being chased by a maniacal killer or a monster of genetic creation.

3. Crazed maniacs have super-human strength.
4. The suburbs are exciting.
5. Good guys always shoot better than bad guys.
6. Good guys are always outnumbered.
7. Good guys always win and get the girl.
8. Good guys are always good looking.
9. Ugly people are always bad guys.
10. Teenagers who have sex are destined to die in grotesque ways.
11. There are no ugly women
column2:
only ugly men.
12. Court cases are all solved with a surprise witness.
13. Good guys are the only ones who have a sense of humor.
14. Cars will explode in all accidents.
15. Everyone has a dark secret.
16. Cream pies are made to be thrown
column3:
never eaten.
17. Haunted houses are never locked.
18. The police are smart.
19. Good guys will only get shot in the arm or leg.
20. All Asian people know Karate.
21. Murders will always be accompanied by sinister music.
22. Rich people are unhappy and evil.
23. Teenagers are smarter than their parents.
24. Indians make good cannon fodder.
25. Thunderstorms spontaneously create murders.

\n

26. Computers never crash.
a) Teenagers can access any computer by using their PC''s.
b) Computers know everything.
c) The same 2 keys are used to do everything
d) The user is typing constantly just to display screens of info

\n

27. When someone is dead or dying
column4:
there will be a trickle of blood from the corner of their mouth.

\n

28. No one farts
column5:
except after eating beans.
29. Nothing cures the blues like killing 30 or 40 bad guys.

\n

30. Bad guys make elaborate inventions to kill the good guys
column6:
but never stick around to see if it works.

31. Christmas Eve and Halloween night last for three or four days.
32. Movies based on true stories are made up.
33. Police never wait for back-up.
34. Undercover cops are too good to be spotted.
35. Private detective work is glamorous.

36. All baseball games will be won with a home run in the bottom of the ninth and two outs.

37. All police killings are in self-defense.
38. Everyone wins in Las Vegas.
39. Good guys don''t do drugs.

40. The world is teeming with voluptuous
column7:
young women who are desperate to have sex with pennyless young guys.

\n

41. Nobody ever has trouble finding good parking spots when they are in a hurry.

\n

42. High School students look thirty years old.
43. Women never do housework
column8:
but their homes are always clean.

\n

44. Street vendors'' carts are magnetically attracted to high-speed car chases.
45. Everyone knows how to pick a lock with one tool.
46. To kill a vampire
column9:
you must set out 5 min before sunset.

\n

47. Nobody ever realizes until the end of a monster movie
column10:
that everyone that went into that dark cellar never came out.

48. The group always splits up to look for the alien.
49. The last 5 minutes of any TV show will explain the entire plot.

50. The last 5 minutes of any TV show will be stretched out for 20 minutes with commercials.

51. The crazed killer always steps out from behind the door without the victim seeing or hearing him until he is about to drive a huge carving knife or pitchfork into them.

52. Whenever someone hears a noise in the dark they always have to check it out.

53. The crazed killer always walks and still catches the person he wants to kill.

54. All people chasing someone can catch up to a constant distance behind them quickly
column11:
but can''t use that speed to actually catch the person they''re chasing.

\n

55. No-one ever locks a car when they get out of it (even in New York).

column1:
To realize the value of ONE YEAR Ask a student who has failed his exam.

To realize the value of ONE MONTH Ask a mother who has given birth to a pre-mature baby.

To realize the value of ONE WEEK Ask an editor of a weekly.

To realize the value of ONE DAY Ask a daily wage laborer.

To realize the value of ONE HOUR Ask the lovers who are waiting to meet.

To realize the value of ONE MINUTE Ask a person who has missed the train.

To realize the value of ONE SECOND Ask a person who has survived an accident.

To realize the value of ONE MILLI-SECOND Ask the person who has won a silver medal in Olympics.

To realize the value of ONE MICRO-SECOND Ask a NASA scientist.

To realize the value of ONE NANO-SECOND Ask a Hardware Engineer.

And if you still don''t realize the value of time you must be a Software Engineer!!!

column1:
A guy dials his home phone number from work. A strange woman answers.

\n

The guy says
column2:
"Who is this?"

\n

"This is the maid."
column3:
answered the woman.

"We don''t have a maid!"

"I was just hired this morning by the lady of the house."

"Well
column4:
this is her husband. Is she there?"

\n

"Ummm...she''s upstairs in the bedroom with someone who I just figured was
her husband."

\n

The guy is fuming. He says to the maid
column5: "Listen
column6:
would you like to make
$50
column7:
000?"

"What do I have to do?"

"I want you to get my gun from my desk in the den and shoot that witch and
the jerk she''s with."

The maid puts down the phone. The guy hears footsteps
column8:
followed by a
couple of gunshots.

The maid comes back to the phone. "What should I do with the bodies?"

"Throw them in the swimming pool!"

"What?! There''s no pool here?" Long pause.

"Uh.. is this 832-4821?"

[San Jose Mercury News]

\n

An unidentified man
column2: using a shotgun like a club to break a former girlfriend''s windshield
column3: accidentally shot himself to death when the gun discharged
column4:

Ken Charles Barger
column6: accidentally shot himself to death in December in Newton
column7: N. C.
column8: when

column10: he reached for the phone but grabbed instead a Smith & Wesson . 38 Special
column11:
which discharged when he drew it to his ear.

\n

A terrible diet and room with no ventilation are being blamed for the death of a man who was killed by his own gas. There was no mark on his body but autopsy showed large amounts of methane gas in his system.

\n

His diet had consisted primarily of beans and cabbage (and a couple of other things). It was just the right combination of foods. It appears that the man died in his sleep from breathing from the poisonous cloud that was hanging over his bed. Had he been outside or had his windows been opened
column12:
it wouldn''t have been fatal. But the man was shut up in his near airtight bedroom. He was a big man with a huge capacity for creating [this deadly gas]. "Three of the rescuers got sick and one was hospitalized.

\n

]Man slips
column13: falls 23 stories to his death. A man cleaning a bird feeder on his balcony of his condominium apartment in a Toronto suburb slipped and fell 23 stories to his death
column14: police said Monday. Stefan Macko
column16: was standing on a wheeled chair Sunday when the accident occurred
column17: said Inspector D''Arcy Honer of the Peel regional police.  "It appears the chair moved and he went over the balcony
column18:
Honer said. It''s one of those freak accidents. No foul play is suspected."

\n

Police said a lawyer demonstrating the safety of windows in a downtown Toronto skyscraper crashed through a pane with his shoulder and plunged 24 floors to his death. A police spokesman said Garry Hoy
column20: fell into the courtyard of the Toronto Dominion Bank Tower early Friday evening as he was explaining the strength of the building''s windows to visiting law students.  Hoy previously had conducted demonstrations of window strength according to police reports. Peter Lauwers
column21: managing partner of the firm Holden Day Wilson
column22:
told the Toronto Sun newspaper that Hoy was "one of the best and brightest" members of the 200-man association.

\n

Six people drowned Monday while trying to rescue a chicken that had fallen into a well in southern Egypt. An 18-year-old farmer was the first to descend into the 60-foot well. He drowned
column23: apparently after an undercurrent in the water pulled him down
column24: police said. His sister and two brothers
column25: none of whom could swim well
column26: went in one by one to help him
column27:
but also drowned.
Two elderly farmers then came to help
column28: but they apparently were pulled by the same undercurrent.  The bodies of the six were later pulled out of the well in the village of Nazlat Imara
column29:
240 miles south of Cairo. The chicken was also pulled out. It survived.

\n

[Times of London] A thief who sneaked into a hospital was scarred for life when he tried to get a suntan. After evading security staff at Odstock Hospital in Salisbury
column30: Wiltshire
column31: and helping himself to doctor''s paging devices
column32: the thief spotted a vertical sun bed. He walked into the unit and removed his clothes for a 45-minute tan.  However
column33: the high-voltage UV machine at the hospital
column34: which is renowned for its treatment of burns victims
column35: has a maximum dosage of 10 seconds. After lying on the bed for almost 300 times the recommended maximum time
column36: the man was covered in blisters. Hours later
column37: when the pain of the burns became unbearable
column38: he went to Southampton General Hospital
column39: 20 miles away
column40:
in Hampshire. Staff became suspicious because he was wearing a doctor''s coat. After tending his wounds they called the police. Southampton police said: "This man broke into Odstock and decided he fancied a quick suntan. Doctors say he is going to be scarred for life.

\n

"More intelligence-challenged people"

\n

column41: Texas
column42: after a mechanic reported to police that 18 packages of marijuana were packed in the engine compartment of the car which she had brought to the mechanic for an oil change. According to police
column43:
Brasher later said that she didn''t realize that the mechanic would have to raise the hood to change the oil.

\n

column44: R. I. Police charged Gregory Rosa
column46:

column1: A husband is at home watching a football game when his wife interrupts
column2: "Honey
column3:
could you fix the light in the hallway?
It''s been flickering for weeks now."

\n

He looks at her and says angrily
column4:
"Fix the light? Now? Does it look like I have a G.E. logo printed on my forehead? I don''t think so."

\n

"Well then
column5:
could you fix the fridge door? It won''t close right."

\n

To which he replied
column6:
"Fix the fridge door? Does it look like I have Westinghouse written on my forehead? I don''t think so."

\n

"Fine
column7:
she says, Then could you at least fix the steps to the front door? They''re about to break."

\n

"I''m not a damn carpenter and I don''t want to fix the steps
column8:
he says. Does it look like I have Ace Hardware written on my forehead? I don''t think so. I''ve had enough of you. I''m going to the bar!!!"

\n

So he goes to the bar and drinks for a couple hours.

\n

He starts to feel guilty about how he treated his wife
column9: and decides to go home and help out. As he walks into the house
column10: he notices the steps are already fixed. As he enters the house
column11: he sees the hall light is working. As he goes to get a beer
column12: he notices the fridge door is fixed. "Honey
column13:
how''d this all get fixed?"

\n

She said
column14: "Well
column15: when you left
column16:
I sat outside and cried.
Just then a nice young man asked me what was wrong
column17: and I told him. He offered to do all the repairs
column18:
and all I had to do was either screw him or bake him a cake."

\n

He said
column19: "So
column20:
what kind of cake did you bake him?"

\n

She replied
column21: "Hellooooo... Do you see Betty Crocker written on my forehead?"

column1: 61. You almost forget how to drive.62. You''ll drink anything if it''s free..63. People still cheat
column2: it''s just more technologically advanced.64. You get really good with excuses for skipping class.65. The girl you''re going to marry may live right next door
column3: so keep your stereo down.66. Ordering food at 1 am is a common occurance.67. You never realized how cool you can be.68. TV becomes a bigger time sucker than ever before.69. You realize how great your hell summer job was once you get to work study.70. Keys have never been so important
column4: yet you seem to lose them more than ever before.

column1: A clergy
column2:
a doctor and a lawyer were at their local country club for their
regular golf game.

\n

Almost immediately they got behind a foursome who were very slow players.
They wandered aimlessly around the fairways looking for their balls
column3:
whiffed shots and putted in all directions. The threesome could not play
through and finally waved down a marshal and explained that each hole took
20 minutes or more and asked if he could encourage the foursome to play at
a quicker pace.

The marshal replied by letting the threesome know that the men in front
were the four firefighters that rescued several club members from a recent
fire and as a result they had lost their eyesight. The club in recognition
of there heroic efforts had given them honorary memberships and were
asking fellow members to be patient when playing behind the firefighters.

The clergy responded by asking the marshal to let the men know that he
would include them in his prayers from the pulpit Sunday morning.

The doctor told the marshal to let the men know he would ask his eye
doctor associates to perform any exams free of charge.

The lawyer looked at the marshal and asked
column4:
"Why can they not just play at
night?"

column1: What is the difference between a dead snake in the road and a dead lawyers in the road?  There are skid marks in front of the snake.

-How do you get down from an elephant?
You don''t. You get down from a duck.

-Why did the elephant paint himself all different colors?
So he could hide in the crayon box.

-Why do elephants have wrinkles?
Because they are so hard to iron.

-Why did the elephant put skates on before he went to bed?
Because he wanted to get rolling in the morning.

-Why can''t an elephant ride a tricycle?
Because it doesn''t have a thumb to ring the bell.

-Why do elephants wear sunglasses?
So no one will recognize them.

-Why are elephants such poor dancers?
Because they have two left feet.

-What time is it when an elephant sits on a fence?
Time to get a new fence.

-Why can''t elephants go swimming at the beach?
Because they can''t keep their trunks up.
The room was full of pregnant women and their partners
column2: and the class was in full swing. The instructor was teaching the women how to breathe properly
column3:
along with informing the men how to give the necessary assurances at this stage of the plan.

\n

The teacher then announced
column4: "Ladies
column5: exercise is good for you. Walking is especially beneficial. And
column6: Gentlemen
column7:
it wouldn''t hurt you to take the time to go walking with your partner.!"

\n

The room really got quiet.
Finally
column8:
a man in the middle of the group raised his hand.
"Yes?" replied the teacher.

\n

column1: With Viagra such a hit
column2: Pfizer Pharmacuticals is bringing forth a whole line of drugs oriented towards improving the performance of men in today''s society. According to company spokesman
column3: Peter Riser
column4:
the following drugs are under testing now:

\n

DIRECTRA - a dose of this drug given to men before leaving on car trips caused 72 percent of them to stop and ask directions when they got lost
column5:
compared to a control group of 0.2 percent.

\n

PROJECTRA - Men given this experimental new drug were far more likely to actually finish a household repair project before starting a new one.

\n

CHILDAGRA - Men taking this drug reported a sudden
column6:
over-whelming urge to perform more child-care tasks - especially cleaning up spills and "little" accidents.

\n

COMPLIMENTRA - In clinical trials
column7:
82 percent of middle-aged men administered this drug noticed that their wives had a new hairstyle. Currently being tested to see if its effects extend to noticing new clothing.

BUYAGRA - Married and otherwise attached men reported a sudden urge to buy their sweeties expensive jewelry and gifts after taking this drug for only two days. Still to be seen: whether the drug can be continued for a period longer than your favorite store''s return limit.

NEGA-VIAGRA - Has the exact opposite effect of Viagra. Currently undergoing clinical trials on sitting U.S. presidents.

NEGA-SPORTAGRA - This drug had the strange effect of making men want to turn off televised sports and actually converse with other family members.

FLATULAGRA - This complex drug converts men''s noxious intestinal gases back into food solids. Special bonus: Dosage can be doubled for long car rides.

FLYAGRA - This drug has been showing great promise in treating men with O.F.D. (Open Fly Disorder). Especially useful for men on Viagra.

PRYAGRA - About to fail its clinical trial
column8:
this drug gave men in the test group an irresistible urge to dig into the personal affairs of other people. Note: Apparent overdose turned three test subjects into "special prosecutors."

\n

LIAGRA - This drug causes men to be less than truthful when being asked about their sexual affairs. Will be available in Regular
column9:
Grand Jury and Presidential Strength versions.
----------------------------------------

\n

The National Organzation For Women is lobbying congress and the FDA to make these new drugs available for sale over the counter
column10:
as well as available in men''s rooms everywhere.

\n

In order to appeal to a boader customer base
column11:
Pfizer is also developing the following drugs intended primarily for women:

NagAgra - Causes Women not to nag their spouse.

HonydewAgra - Causes women to actually do house hold maintenance instead of just writing things down.

InformAgra - Causes women to tell their spouses about plans they have made that involve said spouse.

Butt-outAgra - Causes women not to pry into the personal lives of others and mind their own business.

PersonalAgra - Causes women not to discuss their sex lives with aquaintances of their spouse

SportAgra - Makes women understand the male need for consuming large quantities of fermented beverages while watching contact sports.

Cindi CrawfordAgra - Need I say more?

column1:
A rogue guide dog has been destroyed after leading four of its blind owners
to their deaths.

Charity workers were last night facing an investigation into how
four-year-old Labrador Gamer was allowed to continue his murderous spree.
Officials have admitted how:

  • Victim Nunmber 1 was dragged under the wheels of a bus.
  • Victim Nunmber 2 drowned when she was led off the end of a pier.
  • Victim Nunmber 3 was shoved into the path of a speeding train.
  • Victim Nunmber 4 was left stranded as a truck mowed him down.

Trainer Rudi Jones
column3:
told newsmen in South Africa:
"He was basically a good dog who needed brushing up on his skills.It''s so
sad that he had to be put down."

\n

Gamer''s terror trail began with the death of 43-year-old Selmer Draznower
from Johannesburg. Witnesses told how Gamer dragged his master under the
wheels of an approaching bus before scampering off.

\n

Amazingly
column4:
Gamer was then given to 68-year-old Wilma Hassamore who survived
just three months after his arrival. Gamer decided to cut short her
seaside holiday by leading her off the end of a pier. The dog pulled back
at the last second but Wilma plunged into the sea and drowned.

\n

Next was Marvin Wurtenheim
column6:
who thought his prayers had been answered

column9:
also
from Johannesburg. As Gamer was guiding the unlucky Clarence to his doctor

South
Africa
column13:

the chief trainer for Britain''s Guide Dogs For The Blind
Association
column15: Bob Steele

said: "This could never happen here. If there are
any doubts about the animal
column17:
it is dropped from our training programme at
once."

and

column1:
1. Golf can best be defined as an endless series of tragedies obscured by the
occasional miracle.

\n

2. "I wish I could play my normal game...just once."

\n

3. "Golf is harder than baseball. In golf
column2:
you have to play your foul balls."

column3: the snow
column4:
even during
a hurricane
column5:
here''s a valuable tip: your life is in trouble.

5. Golfers who try to make everything perfect before taking the shot rarely
make a perfect shot.

6. The term "mulligan" is really a contraction of the phrase "maul it again."

7. A "gimme" can best be defined as an agreement between two golfers...neither
of whom can putt very well.

8. An interesting thing about golf is that no matter how badly you play;it is

it
column6:

no reason at all you really stink.

\n

column7: I won''t play.

column1:
- Men would sit around and wonder what WE are thinking.

- Women with cold hands would give men prostate exams.

- PMS would be a legitimate defense in court.

- Men would get reputations for sleeping around.

- Singles bars would have metal detectors to weed out men hiding
wedding rings in their pockets.

- A man would no longer be considered a "good catch" simply
because he is breathing.

- Fewer women would be dieting because their ideal weight
standard would increase by 40 pounds.

- Shopping would be considered an aerobic activity.

- "Ms." Magazine would have an annual swimsuit issue featuring
scantily clad male models.

- Men would not be allowed to eat gas-producing foods within two
hours of bedtime.

- Men would be secretaries for female bosses
column2:
working twice as
hard for none of the credit.

\n

- Little girls would read "Snow White and the Seven Hunks."

\n

- Men would bring drinks
column3:
chips and dip to women watching soap
operas.

\n

- Men would HAVE to get Playboy for the articles
column4:
because there
would be no pictures.

\n

- Men would learn phrases like: "I''m sorry
column5: I love you
column6: You''re beautiful
column7:
Of course you don''t look fat in that
outfit."

\n

- Men would be judged entirely by their looks
column8:
women by their
accomplishments.

- Men would pay as much attention to their woman as to their car.

- All toilet seats would be nailed down.

- Men would work on relationships as much as they work on their
careers.

- TV news segments on sports would never run longer than 1
minute.

- All men would be forced to spend one month in a PMS simulator.

- During mid-life crisis
column9:
men would get hot-flashes and women
would date 19-year-olds.

\n

- Overweight men would have their weight brought to their
attention constantly.

\n

- After a baby is born
column10:
men would take a six-week paternity
leave to wait on their wives hand and foot.

\n

- For basic training
column11:
soldiers would have to take care of a
two-year old for six weeks.

One day in class the teacher brought a bag full of fruit.

and you tell what fruit I''m talking about."

\n

"Okay
column4: first: it''s round
column5:
plump and red."

\n

Of course
column6: Johnny raised his hand high
column7: but the teacher
column8: wisely ignored him and picked Deborah
column9: who promptly answered
column10:

\n

The teacher replied
column11: "No
column12: Deborah
column13: it''s a beet
column14:
but I like your thinking."

\n

"Now for the second. It''s soft
column15: fuzzy
column16:
and colored red and brownish."

Johnny is hopping up and down in his seat trying to get the teacher to call on him. But she skips him again and calls on Billy.

\n

"Is it a peach?" Billy asks. "No
column17: Billy
column18: I''m afraid it''s a potato. But I like your thinking

the teacher replies.

Here''s another: it''s long

and fairly hard."

No

"Nope

column1: You consider your annual bath one too many.You wore a baseball cap to the opera.If you are 20 and you can still go in McDonald''s playhouse.

The other day I went to the local religious book store where I saw a "HONK IF YOU LOVE JESUS" bumper sticker. I bought it and put it on my back bumper and I''m glad I did.

What an uplifting experience followed. That bumper sticker really worked!!

I found lots of people who loved Jesus.

I was stopped at the light at a busy intersection
column2: just lost in thought about the Lord. Why
column3:
the guy behind me started to honk like crazy.

\n

He must REALLY love Jesus because pretty soon he leaned out of his window and yelled "JESUS CHRIST!" as loud as he could.

\n

It was like a football game with him shouting
column4: "GO!...JESUS CHRIST!...GO!" Everyone else started honking too
column5:
so I leaned out the window and smiled and waved to all those loving people.

There must have been a guy from Florida back there because I heard him yell something about a sunny beach and saw him waving with only his middle finger.

I asked my kids what he meant by that and they laughed and said it was the Hawaiian good luck sign. So I leaned out of the window and gave him the good luck sign back.

A couple of people were so caught up in the joy of the moment that they got out of their cars and started running towards me!

I bet they wanted to pray
column6:
but just then I noticed that the light had changed so I stepped on the gas.

It''s a good thing that I did because I was the only driver to get across the intersection.

I looked back and everyone was still standing there so I leaned way out the window and held up the Hawaiian good luck sign as I drove away.

Praise the Lord for such wonderful people!

column1:
***** State laws:

\n

When two trains meet each other at a railroad crossing
column2:
each
shall come to a full stop
column3:
and neither shall proceed until the
other has gone. (No
column4:
I don''t know how that is possible.)

\n

It is illegal to take more than three sips of beer at a time
while standing.

\n

Law prohibits driving without windshield wipers. You don''t need
the windshields
column5:
but you need the wipers.

It is illegal for one to shoot a buffalo from the second story
of a hotel.

You can''t legally milk someone else''s cow.

The entire Encyclopedia Britannica is banned in Texas because it
contains a formula for making beer at home.

***** City laws:

In a certain town
column6:
you must first get a $5 permit before going
barefoot.

\n

It is illegal to idle or loiter anyplace within the corporate
limits of Abilene for the purpose of flirting or mashing.

\n

In Beaumont
column7:
college football is banned at Lamar University.

\n

Dallas bans the possession of "realistic dildos".

\n

In Mesquite
column8:
it is illegal for children to have unusual haircuts.

\n

In San Antonio
column9:
it is illegal to piss on the Alamo. (Law passed
after Ozzy Osbourne did it.)

\n

If you catch a cattle thief in Temple
column10:
you may legally hang him
on the spot.

column1:
The five toughest questions women ask - and their answers:
1. `What are you thinking?''
2. `Do you love me?''
3. `Do I look fat?''
4. `Do you think she''s prettier than me?''
5. `What would you do if I died?''

\n

What makes these questions so bad is that every one is guaranteed to explode into a major argument and/or divorce if the man does not answer properly
column2:
which is to say dishonestly. For example:

\n

1. `What are you thinking?''
The proper answer to this question
column3: of course
column4: is: ''I''m sorry if I''ve been pensive
column5: dear. I was just reflecting on what a warm
column6: wonderful
column7: caring
column8: thoughtful
column9: intelligent
column10: beautiful woman you are and what a lucky guy I am to have met you.'' Obviously
column11: this statement bears no resemblance whatsoever to what the guy was really thinking at the time
column12:
which was most likely one of five things:
a - football.
b - baseball.
c - How fat you are.
d - How much prettier she is than you.
e - How he would spend the insurance money if you died.

\n

The best answer to this stupid question came from Al Bundy
column13: of Married with Children
column14: who was asked it by his wife
column15:
Peg. His answer: ''If I wanted you to know I''d be talking instead of thinking''

\n

The other questions also have only one right answer but many wrong answers:

\n

2. ''Do you love me?''
The correct answer to this question is
column16:
''Yes.''
For those guys who feel the need to be more elaborate
column17:
you may answer. ''Yes dear.''

\n

Wrong answers include:
a - I suppose so.
b - Would it make you feel better if I said yes?
c - That depends on what you mean by ''love''.
d - Does it matter?
e - Who
column18:
me?

\n

3. ''Do I look fat?''
The correct male response to this question is to confidently and emphatically state
column19: ''No
column20:
of course not'' and then quickly leave the room.

\n

Wrong answers include:
a - I wouldn''t call you fat
column21:
but I wouldn''t call you thin either.
b - Compared to what?
c - A little extra weight looks good on you.
d - I''ve seen fatter.
e - Could you repeat the question? I was thinking about your insurance policy.

\n

4. ''Do you think she''s prettier than me?''
The ''she'' in the question could be an ex-girlfriend
column22:
a passerby you were staring at so hard that you almost caused a traffic accident or an actress in a movie you just saw.
In any case
column23: the correct response is: ''No
column24:
you are much prettier.''

\n

Wrong answers include:
a - Not prettier
column25:
just pretty in a different way.
b - I don''t know how one goes about rating such things.
c - Yes
column26:
but I bet you have a better personality.
d - Only in the sense that she''s younger and thinner.
e - Could you repeat the question? I was thinking about your insurance policy.

\n

5. ''What would you do if I died?''

\n

Correct answer: ''Dearest love
column27: in the event of your untimely demise
column28:
life would cease to have meaning for me and I would perforce hurl myself under the front tires of the first truck that came my way.''

\n

This might be the stupidest question of the lot
column29:
as is illustrated by the following stupid joke:

\n

''Dear
column30: '' said the wife
column31:
`what would you do if I died?''

\n

''why
column32: dear
column33: I would be extremely upset
column34:
'' said the husband. ''Why do you ask such a question?''

\n

''Would you remarry?'' persevered the wife.

\n

''No
column35: of course not
column36: dear
column37:
'' said the husband.

\n

''Don''t you like being married?'' said the wife.

\n

''Of course I do
column38: dear
column39:
'' he said.

\n

''Then why wouldn''t you remarry?''

\n

''All right
column40: '' said the husband
column41:
''I''d remarry.''

\n

''You would?'' said the wife
column42:
looking vaguely hurt.

\n

''Yes
column43:
'' said the husband.

\n

`Would you sleep with her in our bed?'' said the wife after a long pause.

\n

''Well yes
column44: I suppose I would
column45:
'' replied the husband.

\n

''I see
column46:
'' said the wife indignantly. ''And would you let her wear my old clothes?''

\n

''I suppose
column47: if she wanted to
column48:
'' said the husband.

\n

''Really
column49:
'' said the wife icily. `And would you take down the pictures of me and replace them with pictures of her?''

\n

''Yes. I think that would be the correct thing to do.''

\n

''Is that so?'' said the wife
column50: leaping to her feet. ''And I suppose you''d let her play with my golf clubs
column51:
too.''

\n

''Of course not
column52: dear

column1:
THE COWBOY CODE

\n

1. A cowboy removes his hat when entering the presence of a lady
column2:
although he may leave it on if she works in a saloon.

\n

2. A cowboy says EXCUSE ME
column3: MA''AM
column4:
when leaving a lady''s presence.

\n

3. A cowboy says PARDON ME
column5: MA''AM
column6: when bumping into a lady
column7:
or treading on her feet.

\n

4. A cowboy never sits
column8: while a lady is standing
column9: unless he feels particularly tired
column10:
or his feet hurt.

\n

5. A cowboy allows a lady to go through a doorway
column11: first
column12:
especially if he thinks one of his enemies may try to shoot him in a cowardly ambush. She would provide good cover.

\n

6 . A cowboy does not spit on the floor
column13: but if he does
column14:
he will point it out to the ladies so they will not drag their skirts through it.

\n

There were three guys sitting behind three nuns at a football game. The men
decided to antagonize the nuns
column2:

the others (loud enough for the women ahead to hear)
column3:

California
column4:
there are only 100 Catholics living there."

\n

column5: "I want to move to Washington
column6:
there are
only 50 Catholics living there." The third guy speaks up and says
column7:

move to Idaho

column1:
THE DEAN
Leaps tall buildings in a single bound.
Is more powerful than a locomotive.
Is faster than a speeding bullet.
Walks on water.
Gives policy to God.
THE DEPARTMENT HEAD
Leaps short buildings in a single bound.
Is more powerful than a switch engine.
Is just as fast as a speeding bullet.
Talks with God.
PROFESSOR
Leaps short buildings with a running start and favorable winds.
Is almost as powerful as a switch engine.
Is faster than a speeding BB.
Walks on water in an indoor swimming pool.
Talks with God if a special request is honored.
ASSOCIATE PROFESSOR
Barely clears a Quonset hut.
Loses tug of war with a locomotive.
Can fire a speeding bullet.
Swims well.
Is occasionally addressed by God.
ASSISTANT PROFESSOR
Makes high marks on the walls when trying to leap tall buildings.
Is run over by locomotives.
Can sometimes handle a gun without inflicting self-injury.
Treads water.
Talks to animals.
INSTRUCTOR
Climbs walls continually.
Rides the rails.
Plays Russian Roulette.
Walks on thin ice.
Prays a lot.
GRADUATE STUDENT
Runs into buildings.
Recognizes locomotives two out of three times.
Is not issued ammunition.
Can stay afloat with a life jacket.
Talks to walls.
UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT
Falls over doorstep when trying to enter buildings.
Says "Look at the choo-choo".
Wets himself with a water pistol.
Plays in mud puddles.
Mumbles to himself THE DEPARTMENT SECRETARY
Lifts tall buildings and walks under them.
Kicks locomotives off the track.
Catches speeding bullets in her teeth and eats them.
Freezes water with a single glance.
She IS God.

column1:
Dear Tech Support:

I am desperate for some help. I recently upgraded from Girlfriend 7.0 to Wife 1.0 and found that the new program began unexpected child processing and also took up a lot of space and valuable resources. This wasn''t mentioned in the product brochure.

In addition Wife 1.0 installs itself into all other programs and launches during system initialisation where it monitors all other system activity.

Applications such as Boys Night Out 2.5
column2:
and Golf 5.3 no longer run and crash the system whenever selected. Attempting to operate Sunday Football 6.3 always fails but Saturday Shopping 7.1 runs instead. I cannot seem to keep Wife 1.0 in the background whilst attempting to run any of my favourite applications. I am thinking about going back to Girlfriend 7.0 but de-install doesn''t work on this program.

\n

Can you please help!
Joe.

\n

Dear Joe
column3:
This is a very common problem resulting from a basic misunderstanding.

Many men upgrade from Girlfriend 7.0 to Wife 1.0 thinking that Wife 1.0 is merely a UTILITIES & ENTERTAINMENT program. Whereas Wife 1.0 is an OPERATING SYSTEM designed by its creator to run everything.

You are unlikely to be able to purge Wife 1.0 and still convert back to Girlfriend 7.0 as Wife 1.0 is not designed to do this and it is impossible to de-install
column4:
delete or purge the program files from the system once installed.

\n

Some people have tried to install Girlfriend 8.0 or Wife 2.0
column5:
but have
ended up with even more problems. (See in manual under Alimony/Child Support and Solicitors Fees). Having Wife 1.0 installed myself I recommend you keep it installed and deal with the difficulties as best you can.

\n

When any faults or problems occur
column6: whatever you think has caused them
column7: you must run the C: IAPOLOGISE program and avoid attempting to use the *Esc-key. It may be necessary to run C: I APOLOGISE a number of times
column8:
but hopefully eventually the operating system will return to normal.

Wife 1.0 although a very high maintenance program can be very rewarding. To get the most out of it consider buying additional software such as Flowers 2.0 and Chocolates 5.0.

Do not under any circumstances install Secretary (Short Skirt version) as this is not a supported application for Wife 1.0 and the system will almost certainly crash.

Best of luck!
Tech Support

You are unlikely to be able to purge Wife 1.0 and still convert back to Girlfriend 7.0 as Wife 1.0 is not designed to do this and it is impossible to de-install
column4:
delete or purge the program files from the system once installed.

\n

Some people have tried to install Girlfriend 8.0 or Wife 2.0
column5:
but have
ended up with even more problems. (See in manual under Alimony/Child Support and Solicitors Fees). Having Wife 1.0 installed myself I recommend you keep it installed and deal with the difficulties as best you can.

\n

When any faults or problems occur
column6: whatever you think has caused them
column7: you must run the C: IAPOLOGISE program and avoid attempting to use the *Esc-key. It may be necessary to run C: I APOLOGISE a number of times
column8:
but hopefully eventually the operating system will return to normal.

Wife 1.0 although a very high maintenance program can be very rewarding. To get the most out of it consider buying additional software such as Flowers 2.0 and Chocolates 5.0.

Do not under any circumstances install Secretary (Short Skirt version) as this is not a supported application for Wife 1.0 and the system will almost certainly crash.

Best of luck!
Tech Support

column1:
Dear Tech Support:

I am desperate for some help. I recently upgraded from Girlfriend 7.0 to Wife 1.0 and found that the new program began unexpected child processing and also took up a lot of space and valuable resources. This wasn''t mentioned in the product brochure.

In addition Wife 1.0 installs itself into all other programs and launches during system initialisation where it monitors all other system activity.

Applications such as Boys Night Out 2.5
column2:
and Golf 5.3 no longer run and crash the system whenever selected. Attempting to operate Sunday Football 6.3 always fails but Saturday Shopping 7.1 runs instead. I cannot seem to keep Wife 1.0 in the background whilst attempting to run any of my favourite applications. I am thinking about going back to Girlfriend 7.0 but de-install doesn''t work on this program.

\n

Can you please help!
Joe.

\n

Dear Joe
column3:
This is a very common problem resulting from a basic misunderstanding.

Many men upgrade from Girlfriend 7.0 to Wife 1.0 thinking that Wife 1.0 is merely a UTILITIES & ENTERTAINMENT program. Whereas Wife 1.0 is an OPERATING SYSTEM designed by its creator to run everything.

You are unlikely to be able to purge Wife 1.0 and still convert back to Girlfriend 7.0 as Wife 1.0 is not designed to do this and it is impossible to de-install
column4:
delete or purge the program files from the system once installed.

\n

Some people have tried to install Girlfriend 8.0 or Wife 2.0
column5:
but have
ended up with even more problems. (See in manual under Alimony/Child Support and Solicitors Fees). Having Wife 1.0 installed myself I recommend you keep it installed and deal with the difficulties as best you can.

\n

When any faults or problems occur
column6: whatever you think has caused them
column7: you must run the C: IAPOLOGISE program and avoid attempting to use the *Esc-key. It may be necessary to run C: I APOLOGISE a number of times
column8:
but hopefully eventually the operating system will return to normal.

Wife 1.0 although a very high maintenance program can be very rewarding. To get the most out of it consider buying additional software such as Flowers 2.0 and Chocolates 5.0.

Do not under any circumstances install Secretary (Short Skirt version) as this is not a supported application for Wife 1.0 and the system will almost certainly crash.

Best of luck!
Tech Support

column1: Three guys died and when they got to the pearly gates
column2:
St. Peter met them
there.
St. Peter said
column3:
"I know that you guys are forgiven because you''re here. But
before I let you into heaven
column4:
I have to ask you a couple of questions. Make sure
you tell the truth because if you don''t
column5:
we''ll have to ask you to visit the
beast below. Your answers will also determine what kind of car you will get. You
have to have a car here in heaven because it is so huge!"
St. Peter asked the first man
column6:
"How long were you married?"
The guy replied
column7:
"24 years."
St. Peter then asked
column8:
"Did you ever cheat on your wife?"
The guy said
column9: "Yeah
column10:
about 10 times... but you said I was forgiven."
Peter said
column11: "Yes
column12:
but that''s not too good. Here''s a Pinto for you to drive."
The second guy got the same questions from Peter to whom he replied
column13:
"I was
married for 41 years and cheated on her only once
column14:
but that was during our first
year and we worked it out. I was faithful thereafter."
Peter said
column15:
"I''m pleased to hear that. Here''s a Mercedes SUV for you to
drive."
The third guy said
column16: "Peter
column17:
I know what you''re going to ask. I was married for
63 years and didn''t even look at another woman! I treated my wife like a queen!"

\n

Peter said
column18:
"Now that''s what I like to hear! Here''s a Jaguar for you to
drive."
A little while later
column19:
the two guys with the Lincoln and the Pinto saw the guy
with the Jaguar crying on the golden sidewalk
column20:
so they went to see what the
matter was. When they asked him what was wrong he wearily said
column21:
"I just saw my
wife and she was on a skateboard!"

column1: A little boy was overheard talking to himself as he strutted through the backyard
column2: wearing his baseball cap and toting a ball and bat. "I''m the greatest hitter in the world
column3:
he
announced.

\n

Then, he tossed the ball into the air, swung at it, and missed.

\n

Strike One!" he yelled. Undaunted
column4: he picked up the ball and said again
column5:
"I''m the greatest hitter in the world!"

\n

He tossed the ball into the air. When it came down he swung again and missed. "Strike Two!" he cried.

\n

The boy then paused a moment to examine his bat and ball carefully. He spit on his hands and rubbed them together. He straightened his cap and said once more
column6:
"I''m the greatest
hitter in the world!"

\n

Again he tossed the ball up in the air and swung at it. He missed. "Strike Three!"

\n

"Wow!" he exclaimed. "I''m also the greatest pitcher in the world!"

column1:
A golfer became so mad that he threw his brand new set of golf clubs into the
lake.

\n

A few minutes later he came back
column2:
waded into the lake and retrieved his
clubs.

\n

He proceeded to take his car keys out of the bag -- then threw the
clubs back into the water.

column1:
There was this basically-good man who died and appeared before St. Peter at
the Holy Gates. St. Peter checks out his books and discovers that there is a
problem. He says that there is no clear answer in the books on where the man is
supposed to go
column2:
Heaven or Hell. He suggests that the man go to Hell and check it
out
column3:
so that he may make the decision himself. If he didn''t like what he saw
there
column4:
he could come back to Heaven.

\n

Well
column5:
this man had only one true vice while he was alive. It seems he had an
uncontrollable desire to play golf at any opportunity. He had traveled the world
playing all the famous golf courses.

\n

When the man arrived in Hell
column6: Satan welcomed him
column7:
but he too was surprised at
the man''s situation. He had assumed that since the question about the man''s
ultimate destination wasn''t clear
column8:
the man would go to Heaven. The man could
just see behind Satan a Most Beautiful Golf Course. It had beautiful trees
column9:
blue
ponds
column10: water separating the fairways
column11:
everything. The man fell in love with at
at first site
column12:
and he couldn''t control himself. He just had to play a round.

\n

The devil showed him a wonderful electric golf cart
column13: a perfect leather bag
column14:
a
matched set of clubs. Satan reached into his pocket and presented the man with a
Golden Tee. The devil then said that only members could play. The man couldn''t
control himself. He just had to play there.

\n

He goes back up to Heaven and tells St. Peter that he has decided to stay in
Hell so he could play on the Beautiful Golf Course there. When the man returns
to Hell
column15:
he approaches Satan and asks for a tee time. The devil says that
anytime at all
column16:
the man could play. No one else uses the course.

\n

Chuckling with glee
column17:
the man approaches the first tee. He gets out of his
beautiful golf cart
column18:
reaches for his perfectly matched clubs and selects his
driver
column19: reaches into his pants pocket and pulls out his Golden Tee
column20:
then
frantically searches everywhere for a ball.

\n

Satan comes up and the man asks him for a ball.

\n

"That''s the Hell of it

Rugby.4.See above. 5. See above. 6. See above. 7. See above. 8. See above. 9. See above. 10. You get to hate everyone else... unless it''s their round. Question: Why did the chicken cross the road?

KINDERGARTEN TEACHER: To get to the other side.

PLATO: For the greater good.

ARISTOTLE: It is the nature of chickens to cross roads.

KARL MARX: It was a historical inevitability.

TIMOTHY LEARY: Because that''s the only trip the establishment
would let it take.

SADDAM HUSSEIN: This was an unprovoked act of rebellion and we
were quite justified in dropping 50 tons of nerve gas on it.

RONALD REAGAN: I forget.

CAPTAIN JAMES T. KIRK: To boldly go where no chicken has gone
before.

HIPPOCRATES: Because of an excess of phlegm in its pancreas.

ANDERSEN CONSULTING: Deregulation of the chicken''s side of the
road was threatening its dominant market position. The chicken
was faced with significant challenges to create and develop the
competencies required for the newly competitive market. Andersen
Consulting, in a partnering relationship with the client, helped
the chicken by rethinking its physical distribution strategy and
implementation processes. Using the Poultry Integration Model
(PIM), Andersen helped the chicken use its skills,
methodologies, knowledge, capital and experiences to align the
chicken''s people, processes and technology in support of its
overall strategy within a Program Management framework. Andersen
Consulting convened a diverse cross-spectrum of road analysts
and best chickens along with Anderson consultants with deep
skills in the transportation industry to engage in a two-day
itinerary of meetings in order to leverage their personal
knowledge capital, both tacit and explicit, and to enable them
to synergize with each other in order to achieve the implicit
goals of delivering and successfully architecting and
implementing an enterprise-wide value framework across the
