column1:
London made its pitch to host the 2012 Olympic Games last week.

England has an unfair advantage when it comes to bribing IOC members.

Hookers are nice and cash is sweet but a dukedom is something your family will have for a thousand years.

-Argus Hamilton
Situations you may find yourself in
column2:
and the orgasms you may encounter...

Sex in a boat - oar-gasms.

Sex with a nerd - dork-gasms.

Sex at the entrance to your house - door-gasms.

Sex on carpet or linoleum - floor-gasms.

Sex at the supermarket - store-gasms.

Sex at a Steven King Movie - horror-gasms.

Sex with a prostitute - whore-gasms.

Sex with an accountant - bore-gasms.

Sex while sleeping - snore-gasms.

Sex with ''Arthur'' - Dudley Moore-gasms.

Sex with cartoon donkeys - Eyeore-gasms.

Sex while broke - poor-gasms.

Sex with a lion - roar-gasms.

Sex for hours and hours on end - sore-gasms.

Sex on a golf course - fore-gasms.

Sex with a nymphomaniac (or Ritzi) - more-gasms.

Sex in a gold mine - ore-gasms.

Sex with a dermatologist - pore-gasms.

Sex with a politician - Al Gore-gasms.

Sex with Chocolate
column3: marshmallows
column4:
and graham crackers - s''more-gasms.

Sex with a bullfighter - toreador-gasms.

Sex with a masked man carrying a sword - zorro-gasms.

Sex on the beach - shore-gasms.

Sex at an all-you-can-eat buffet - smorgasbord-gasms.

Sex on a cruise ship deck - shuffleboard-gasms.

Sex in asia - Singapore-gasms.

Sex among the wonders of nature - outdoor-gasms.

Sex in the vicinity of a garbage can - odor-gasms.

Sex on the way to the train - ''All Aboard''-gasms.

Sex that wasn''t very satisfying - ''There''s the door''-gasms.

Sex in an adult theater - hard-core-gasms.

Sex with someone who''s not paying attention - ignore-gasms.

Sex with a competitive partner - score-gasms.

Sex while flying - soar-gasms.

Sex with a beloved partner - adore-gasms.

Sex with a meat-eater - carnivore-gasms.

Sex with a person who''s got a really bad hairdo - pompadore-gasms.

Sex with someone who''s got bad taste in clothes - velour-gasms.

Sex while travelling - tour-gasms.

Sex with a big dog - labrador-gasms.

Sex with Beavis and Butthead - ''GonnaScore''-gasms.

Sex on stairs at the mall - escalator-gasms.

Sex with three of your friends - four-gasms.

Sex with a norse God - Thor-gasms.

Sex when resistance is futile - Borg-gasms.

column1:
On their wedding night the new couple are just about to do the deed when the wife tells her new husband that she has a confession.
"I lied when I told you I was a virgin. I have been with one other man" she tells her new hubby.

The new husband asks if it was anyone he knows?.
The wife answers ...well maybe!

Husband asks who it was.
The wife answers - it was Tiger Woods.

Since the only other person his new bride every slept with was the famous Tiger Woods
column2: he''s not at all upset and they get down to it and do the honeymoon "thing". When finished
column3:
the husband gets out of bed and reaches for the telephone.

\n

"What are you doing?" asked his bride.
"I''m calling for room service. After all that work I''m hungry!"

\n

The wife says
column4:
"Tiger wouldn''t do that."
"Really! Just what would TIGER do?" says the husband.

\n

Well we would do it again!

\n

Ok says the husband and jumps into the bed.
This same thing happens two more times
column5:
after which the guy is pretty tired.

\n

So he drags himself out of bed and gets to the telephone.
The wife says..you''re not calling room service are you!!!!
"NO
column6:
says the exhausted hubby"!
"Well who are you calling then
column7:
she asks."

\n

I''m calling Tiger Woods...
I want to see what par is for this hole!

column1:
A guy walks into a bar with his dog. They both go up to the barstool and sit down. The owner orders two beers.

\n

The bartendar just frowns and says
column2: "Look buddy
column3:
we can''t have any dogs sitting up at the bar."

\n

The owner retorts
column4:
"But this is no ordinary dog." The bartendar doesn''t budge from his stance and tells the guy to leave.

\n

The owner protests
column5: "Look
column6:
this is no ordinary dog. This is a talking dog."

\n

The bartendar says
column7:
"Yeah right buddy.
Okay
column8:
why don''t you and your talking dog leave the bar?"

\n

The owner says
column9: "Okay
column10: I''ll tell you what. I''ll go into the bathroom and take a leak. You can talk to my dog while I go. If you still want us to leave when I get back
column11:
we will."

\n

So the owner leaves. And the dog and the bartendar start talking it up like they are long lost friends. The bartendar starts to really like this dog. There talking about sports and beer and women.

\n

So the bartendar comes up with an idea. He turns to the dog and says
column12: "Look
column13:
I have a friend who owns the bar across the street. If I give you $20 will you go into the bar and order a beer from him?"
The dog says
column14: "No problem"
column15:
and gets up and leaves.

\n

The owner comes back and ask where his dog is. The bartenday explains about the joke. So the owner leaves to get his dog.

\n

Right out of the bar
column16: the owner sees his dog humping another lady dog. And the owner says
column17: "Hey
column18:
get off of her. Why have I never seen you doing this before?"
To which the dog replies
column19: "Because I have never had $20 before."

column1: With Viagra such a hit
column2:
Pfizer is bringing forth a whole line of drugs
oriented towards improving the
performance of men in today''s society.
DIRECTRA - A dose of this drug given to men before leaving on car trips caused
72 percent of them to stop and ask for directions when they got lost
column3:
compared
to a control group where only 0.2 percent asked for directions.
PROJECTRA - Men given this experimental new drug were far more likely to
actually finish a household repair
project before starting a new one.
CHILDAGRA - Men taking this drug reported a sudden
column4:
overwhelming urge to
perform more child-care tasks-especially cleaning up spills and little
accidents.
COMPLIMENTRA - In clinical trials
column5:
82 percent of middle-aged men administered
this drug noticed that their wives had a new hairstyle. Currently being tested
to see if its effects extend to noticing new clothing.
BUYAGRA - Married and otherwise attached men reported a
sudden urge to buy their sweeties expensive jewelry and gifts after taking
this drug for only two days. Still to be seen:
whether the drug can be continued for a period longer thanyour favorites
store''s return limit.
NEGA-VIAGRA - Has the exact opposite effect of Viagra.
Currently undergoing clinical trials on sitting U.S.
presidents.
NEGA-SPORTAGRA - This drug had the strange effect of making men want to turn
off televised sports and actually converse with other family members.
CAPAGRA - Caused test subjects to become
uncharacteristically fastidious about lowering toilet seats and replacing
toothpaste caps. Subjects on higher doses were seen dusting furniture.
PRYAGRA - About to fail its clinical trial
column6:
this drug gave men in the test
group an irresistible urge to dig into the personal affairs of other people.
Note: Apparent over-dose turned three test subjects into special prosecutors.
LIAGRA - This drug causes men to be less than truthful when they are asked
about their sexual affairs. Will be available in Regular
column7:
Grand Jury and
Presidential Strength versions.

column1: ''Resumania'' is a term coined by Mr. Robert Half
column2: founder of RHI Consulting''s parent company
column3: to describe the unintentional bloopers that often appear on job candidates'' resumes
column4:
job applications and cover letters. Here''s some examples:

\n

''I perform my job with effortless efficiency
column5: effectiveness
column6: efficacy
column7: and expertise.'' (And an eye on the ''e'' section of the dictionary
column8:
evidently.)

\n

''Insufficient writing skills
column9: thought processes have slowed down some. If I am not one of the best
column10:
I will look for another opportunity.''(No problem ...)

\n

''Seek challenges that test my mind and body
column11:
since the two are usually inseparable. ''(Glad to hear it.)

''I am very detail-oreinted. ''(With the possible exception of spelling)

''I can play well with others.'' (We''ll be sure to tell your mommy.)

''Married
column12:
eight children. Prefer frequent travel.'' (A new twist on work-family balance.)

''Objection: To utilize my skills in sales.'' (Have you considered law school?)

''My salary requirement is $34 per year.'' (They say money isn''t everything.)

''Served as assistant sore manager.'' (Ouch.)

''Work history: Bum. Abandoned belongings and led nomadic lifestyle.'' (So you''re willing to travel?)

''I vow to fulfill the goals of the company as long as I live.'' (And they say loyalty is hard to come by.)

''Reason for leaving last job: Pushed aside so the vice president''s girlfriend could steal my job.'' (We''re glad you''re not bitter.)

column1:
What''s the difference between 3 golf balls and a period?

\n

You can''t gargle 3 golf balls!!!
Good afternoon. I''m Al Gore
column2:
and I''d like to tell you about myself.
I know a lot about hardship
column3:
because I came into this world as a poor black
child in a tiny town in the backwoods of Tennessee. I was born in a log cabin
that I built with my own hands. I taught myself to read by candlelight and
helped support my 16 brothers and sisters by working summers as a deck hand on a
Mississippi River steamboat.
My mother taught me the value of education
column4:
so every day; I would walk 5 miles
to a one-room schoolhouse. I was a mischievous
column5: fun-loving scamp
column6:
thought I
never dreamed that one-day
column7:
my youthful escapades would serve as the inspiration
for "Huckleberry Finn."
Back then
column8: black folks in the south were second-class citizens. One day
column9:
a
traveling minister came through town
column10:
and I asked him if anyone was ever going
to do something to guarantee civil rights for all Americans. Well
column11:
I guess I
made an impression. You see
column12: the minister''s name was Martin Luther King
column13:
Jr.
My father was a United States Senator. He once perched me on his knee and
said
column14: "Son
column15: if you work hard and listen to your mama
column16:
someday you can live in a
hotel in Washington
column17: D.C.
column18:
and go to an exclusive prep school."
But life of privilege was not for me. After getting my high school diploma
column19:
I
took a job in a hot
column20:
dirty textile mill. I was so appalled at the treatment of
the workers there that I organized a union. Later
column21:
that experience inspired a
movie - which is why
column22: to this day
column23:
my close friends at the AFL-CIO call me
"Norma Rae."
When word got out what an 18 year old factory worker had done
column24:
Harvard called
and offered me a scholarship. I captained the hockey team to four consecutive
national championships
column25:
but I also played football and was good enough to win
the Heisman Trophy.
During my college years
column26:
I lived in a housing project and moonlighted playing
lead guitar for a little rock band. You may have heard of it-the Rolling
Stones.
But there was a war going on
column27:
and I felt I had to serve my country. So
I enlisted in the U. S. Army and went to Vietnam. I was deeply opposed to the
war
column28:
but I did my duty as a soldier and came back home with the Medal of Honor
and the Croix de Guerre.
When I got back
column29:
I took a long journey across this great land of ours. I''ve
crossed the deserts bare
column30: man
column31: I''ve breathed the mountain air
column32: man
column33:
I''ve
traveled
column34: I''ve done my share
column35: man
column36:
I''ve been everywhere. And the people I met at
truck stops and campgrounds and homeless shelters on that journey all said the
same thing: "Al
column37:
we need you in Washington."
I knew they were right
column38:
but first I had to take care of some other
business---building the World Trade Center
column39: founding the Audubon Society
column40:
doing
the clinical research that proved smoking caused cancer
column41:
and coming up with the
recipe for Mrs. Field''s chocolate chip cookies.
Finally
column42:
I deferred to the demands of the people of Tennessee and allowed them
to elect me to the House of Representatives and the Senate
column43:
where I established
the US Strategic Oil Reserve. And then one winter day nearly nine years ago
column44:
for
no particular reason
column45:
I answered the call of the people once again and took the
oath of office as Vice President of the United States.
Since then
column46:
I''ve been part of the most successful administration in American
history. And
column47: in my spare time
column48:
I invented the Internet. Many times Bill Clinton
has been pondering some grave decision and has asked me what to do. And when I
would give him my thoughts
column49: he would invariable say
column50:
"Of course. That''s
brilliant. Why didn''t I think of that?"
During the darkest days of the impeachment battle
column51:
the president told me he
only wished he had listened when I told him to stay away form that dark-haired
intern. So after I decided to run for president
column52:
I sat down with him and asked
if he had any suggestions about how to conduct my campaign. And Bill Clinton
gave me a few simple words of advice-words I''ll never forget.
He looked me in the eye and he said
column54: just tell the truth
column55:
it''s always
worked for me."

column1:
A husband and wife are traveling by car from Key West to Boston.
After almost twenty-four hours on the road
column2:
they''re too tired to
continue
column3:
and they decide to stop for a rest. They stop at a
nice hotel and take a room
column4:
but they only plan to sleep for four
hours and then get back on the road. When they check out four
hours later
column5:
the desk clerk hands them a bill for $350.

\n

The man explodes and demands to know why the charge is so
high. He tells the clerk although it''s a nice hotel
column6:
the rooms
certainly aren''t worth $350. When the clerk tells him $350 is
the standard rate
column7:
the man insists on speaking to the manager.

\n

The manager appears
column8: listens to the man
column9:
and then explains that
the hotel has an Olympic sized pool and a huge conference
center that were available for the husband and wife to use.

\n

"But we didn''t use them." the man complains. "Well
column10:
they are
here
column11:
and you could have." explains the manager.

\n

He goes on to explain they could have taken in one of the shows
for which the hotel is famous. "The best entertainers from New
York
column12:
Hollywood and Las Vegas perform here." the manager says.
"But we didn''t go to any of those shows." complains the man
again.

\n

"Well
column13: we have them
column14:
and you could have." the manager replies.
No matter what facility the manager mentions
column15: the man replies
column16:
"But we didn''t use it!"

\n

The manager is unmoved
column17:
and eventually the man gives up and
agrees to pay. He writes a check and gives it to the manager.
The mnager is surprised when he looks at the check. "But sir
column18:
he says, this check is only made out for $100."

\n

"That''s right
column19:
says the man. I charged you $250 for sleeping
with my wife."

\n

"But I didn''t!" exclaims the mnager.

\n

"Well
column20: the man replies, she was here
column21: and you could have."

column1:
A man traveling down a country road was forced to stop before a giant puddle
covering the entire road. Looking to the side of the road
column2:
the man noticed a
farmer leaning on a fence. "Think it''s safe to cross?" the man asked.

\n

"I reckon so
column3:
replied the farmer.

\n

The puddle immediately swallowed the car as the man drove in. In fact, it was
so deep that he had to roll his window down to swim out of his car back to the
surface. As his head broke the surface, the man said to the farmer, I thought
you said I could safely drive through this puddle!"

\n

"Well
column4: shoot!" said the farmer
column5:
scratching his head. "It only come up
chest-high on my ducks!"

\n

One morning a boy got up and was leaving the house with a hand full of chicken
wire. His father said
column6: ''Son
column7: where are you going?'' The son replied
column8:
''I''m going
to catch me some chickens.'' The father said
column9: ''Son
column10:
you can''t catch chickens with
chicken wire.'' But the son insisted that he knew what he was doing.

\n

Later on that day
column11:
the son came home with two chickens in his hand. The father
thought
column12: ''I guess he knows what he''s doing.'' The next morning
column13:
the son got up
and was leaving the house with some duck tape. The father said
column14: ''Son
column15:
where are
you going?'' The son replied
column16: ''I''m going to catch some ducks.'' The father yelled
column17:
''You can''t catch ducks with duck tape!'' The son insisted that he knew what he
was doing.

\n

Awhile later
column18:
the son came home with two ducks under each arm. The father
thought
column19: ''Shoot
column20:
I guess he does know what he''s doing!'' The next morning the son
got up and was leaving the house with a hand full of puss willows. The father
said
column21: ''Hold up
column22: son
column23: let me put on my shoes!''

column1: December 14
column2:
1972

My dearest darling John:

Who ever in the whole world would dream of getting a real
Partridge in a Pear Tree? How can I ever express my pleasure.
Thank you a hundred times for thinking of me this way.

My love always
column4:
1972

Dearest John:

Today the postman brought your very sweet gift. Just imagine two
turtle doves. I''m just delighted at your very thoughtful gift.
They are just adorable.

All my love
column6:
1972

\n

Dear John:

\n

Oh! Aren''t you the extravagant one. Now I must protest. I don''t
deserve such generosity
column7:
three French hens. They are just
darling but I must insist
column8:
you''ve been too kind.

\n

All my love
column10:
1972

\n

Dear John:

\n

Today the postman delivered four calling birds. Now really
column11:
they
are beautiful
column12:
but don''t you think enough is enough. You are
being too romantic.

\n

Affectionately
column14:
1972

\n

Dearest John:

\n

What a surprise. Today the postman delivered five golden rings
column15: one for every finger. You''re just impossible
column16:
but I love it.
Frankly
column17:
all those birds squawking were beginning to get on my
nerves.

\n

All my love
column19:
1972

Dear John:

When I opened the door today there were actually six geese
laying on my front steps. So you''re back to the birds again huh?
These geese are huge. Where will I ever keep them? The neighbors
are complaining and I can''t sleep through the racket. Please
stop.

Cordially
column21:
1972

John:

What''s with you and those freaking birds?? Seven swans a
swimming. What kind of damn joke is this? There''s bird poop all
over the house and they never stop the racket. I can''t sleep at
night and I''m a nervous wreck. It''s not funny. So stop those
freaking birds.

Sincerely
column23:
1972

\n

O.K. Buster:

\n

I think I prefer the birds. What the hell am I going to do with
8 maids a milking? It''s not enough with all those birds and 8
maids a milking
column24:
but they had to bring their damn cows. There is
manure all over the lawn and I can''t move in my own house. Just
lay off me
column26:
1972

Hey Shithead:

What are you? Some kind of sadist? Now there''s nine pipers
playing. And Christ do they play. They''ve never stopped chasing
those maids since they got here yesterday morning. The cows are
getting upset and they''re stepping all over those screeching
birds. What am I going to do? The neighbors have started a
petition to evict me.

You''ll get yours !
Agnes

==========================================================
December 23
column27:
1972

You rotten prick:

Now there''s ten ladies dancing. I don''t know why I call those
sluts ladies. They''ve been balling those pipers all night long.

Now the cows can''t sleep and they''ve got diarrhea. My living
room is a river of shit. The Commissioner of Buildings has
subpoenaed me to give cause why the building shouldn''t be
condemned.

I''m calling the police on you !
Agnes

=========================================================
December 24
column28:
1972

\n

Listen Fuckhead:

\n

What''s with those eleven lords a leaping on those maids and
ladies? Some of those broads will never walk again. Those pipers
ran through the maids and have been committing sodomy with the
cows. All twenty-three of the birds are dead. They''ve been
trampled to death in the orgy. I hope you''re satisfied
column29:
you
rotten vicious swine.

\n

Your sworn enemy

1972

\n

Dear Sir:

\n

This is to acknowledge your latest gift of twelve fiddlers
fiddling which you have seen fit to inflict on our client

The destruction
column33: of course

the attendants have been

column1:
1. Garbage bags do not make good parachutes.

\n

2. A 3-year-old is louder than 200 adults in a crowded restaurant.

\n

3. If you spray hair spray on dust bunnies and run over them with roller blades
column2:
they can ignite.

\n

4. If you hook a dog leash over a ceiling fan
column3:
the motor is not strong enough to rotate a 42-pound boy wearing Batman underwear and a superman cape.

\n

5. When using the ceiling fan as a baseball bat
column4:
you have to throw the ball up a few times before you get a hit.

\n

6. The glass in windows - even double pane - cannot stop a baseball hit by a ceiling fan.

\n

7. When you hear the toilet flush and the words "Uh-oh
column5:
it''s already too late.

8. Brake fluid mixed with Clorox makes smoke, and lots of it.

9. A young child can start a fire with a flint rock even though a 36-year-old man says they can only do it in the movies. A magnifying glass can start a fire even on an overcast day.

10. Small Legos will successfully pass through the digestive tract of a six-year-old.

11. Play-Doh" and "microwave" should never be used in the same sentence.

12. Super glue is permanent.

13. No matter how much Jell-O you put in a swimming pool
column6:
you still can''t walk on water.

14. VCRs will not spontaneously eject PB&J sandwiches

15. A king size waterbed holds enough water to fill a 2000 sq. foot house 4 inches deep.

16. Marbles in gas tanks make lots of noise in a moving car.

17. You probably do not want to know what that odor is.

18. Always look in the oven before you turn it on. Plastic toys do not taste or smell better baked.

19. The spin cycle on the washing machine does make earthworms squirm.

20. Making a cat dizzy will cause it to spit up twice its body weight.

column1:
A mother is having sex with her lover.

Her son comes in so she locks him in the closet. After hearing her husband come home she locks the lover also in the closet.

"Dark in here" the boy says.

"Yeah" the man replies.

"I have a baseball here. Do you want it? It costs only $250 bucks."

The man thought what the hell and paid up.

Next night the boy is again locked in the closet with the lover.

"Dark in here" the boy says.

"Yeah" the man replies.

"Do you want a baseball glove?" The boy says.

The man bought it for $750 bucks.

The next day the father says " Son
column2:
lets go to play baseball"

The boy says "I sold my baseball and glove for $1000 bucks"

The father says "You should not overcharge your friends like that. I''m going to take you to the Confessional" And so the boy goes.

He goes into the Confessional.

"Dark in here" he comments.

"Oh

for heavens sake don''t start that again!" The priest says.

column1: After a particularly poor game of golf
column2: a popular club member skipped the clubhouse and started to go home. As he was walking to the parking lot to get his car
column3: a policeman stopped him and asked
column4: "Did you tee off on the sixteenth hole about twenty minutes ago?" "Yes
column5: the golfer responded. Did you happen to hook your ball so that it went over the trees and off the course?" "Yes
column6: I did. How did you know?" he asked. "Well
column7: said the policeman very seriously, Your ball flew out onto the highway and crashed through a driver''s windshield. The car went out of control
column8: crashing into five other cars and a fire truck. The fire truck couldn''t make it to the fire
column9: and the building burned down. So
column10: what are you going to do about it?" The golfer thought it over carefully and responded... "I think I''ll close my stance a little bit
column11: tighten my grip and lower my right thumb."

column7: I really want to know. Please...""Well

column12: remember when you were 35 years old and you really wanted to start the business on your own and no bank would give you a loan? Remember
column13: then one day the bank president himself came over the house and signed the loan papers
column14: no questions asked?""Oh
column15: Becky
column16: you did that for me! I respect you even more than ever
column17: to do such a thing for me. So
column18: when was number 2?""Well
column19: Sam
column20: remember when you had that last heart attack and you were needing that very tricky operation

column22: to do the surgery himself

column24: you should do such a thing for me

column1: Dilberted To be exploited and oppressed by your boss. Derived from the experiences of Dilbert
column2:
the geek-in-hell comic strip character. "I''ve been dilberted again. The old man revised the specs for the fourth time this week."

\n

Link Rot The process by which links on a web page became obsolete as the sites they''re connected to change location or die.

\n

Chip Jewelry A euphemism for old computers destined to be scrapped or turned into decorative ornaments. "I paid three grand for that Mac SE
column3:
and now it''s nothing but chip jewelry."

\n

Crapplet A badly written or profoundly useless Java applet. "I just wasted 30 minutes downloading this stinkin'' crapplet!"

\n

Plug-and-Play A new hire who doesn''t need any training. "The new guy
column4: John
column5:
is great. He''s totally plug-and-play."

World Wide Wait The real meaning of WWW.

CGI Joe A hard-core CGI script programmer with all the social skills and charisma of a plastic action figure.

Dorito Syndrome Feelings of emptiness and dissatisfaction triggered by addictive substances that lack nutritional content. "I just spent six hours surfing the Web
column6:
and now I''ve got a bad case of Dorito Syndrome."

Under Mouse Arrest Getting busted for violating an online service''s rule of conduct. "Sorry I couldn''t get back to you. AOL put me under mouse arrest."

Glazing Corporate-speak for sleeping with your eyes open. A popular pastime at conferences and early-morning meetings. "Didn''t he notice that half the room was glazing by the second session?"

404 Someone who''s clueless. From the World Wide Web message "404
column7: URL Not Found
column8: meaning that the document you''ve tried to access can''t be located. Don''t bother asking him...he''s 404
column9:
man."

\n

Dead Tree Edition The paper version of a publication available in both paper and electronic forms
column10:
as in: "The dead tree edition of the San Francisco Chronicle..."

\n

Egosurfing Scanning the net
column11: databases
column12: print media
column13:
or research papers looking for the mention of your name.

\n

Graybar Land The place you go while you''re staring at a computer that''s processing something very slowly (while you watch the gray bar creep across the screen). "I was in graybar land for what seemed like hours
column14:
thanks to that CAD rendering."

Open-Collar Workers People who work at home or telecommute.

Squirt The Bird To transmit a signal up to a satellite. "Crew and talent are ready...what time do we squirt the bird?"

Brain Fart A biproduct of a bloated mind producing information effortlessly. A burst of useful information. "I know you''re busy on the Microsoft story
column15:
but can you give us a brain fart on the Mitnik bust?" Variation of old hackerslang that had more negative connotations.

Keyboard Plaque The disgusting buildup of dirt and crud found on computer keyboards. "Are there any other terminals I can use? This one has a bad case of keyboard plaque."

Career-Limiting Move (CLM) Used among microserfs to describe an ill-advised activity. Trashing your boss while he or she is within earshot is a serious CLM.

Alpha Geek The most knowledgeable
column16: technically-proficient person in an office or work group. "Ask Larry
column17:
he''s the alpha geek around here."

Adminisphere The rarified organizational layers beginning just above the rank and file. Decisions that fall from the adminisphere are often profoundly inappropriate or irrelevant to the problems they were designed to solve.

Tourists People who are taking training classes just to get a vacation from their jobs. "We had about three serious students in the class; the rest were tourists."

Blowing Your Buffer Losing one''s train of thought. Occurs when the person you are speaking with won''t let you get a word in edgewise or has just said something so astonishing that your train gets derailed. "Damn
column18:
I just blew my buffer!"

\n

Gray Matter Older
column19:
experienced business people hired by young entrepreneurial firms looking to appear more reputable and established.

Bookmark To take note of a person for future reference (a metaphor borrowed from web browsers). "I bookmarked him after seeing his cool demo at Siggraph."

Nyetscape Nickname for AOL''s less-than-full-featured Web browser.

Beepilepsy The brief seizure people sometimes suffer when their beepers go off
column20: especially in vibrator mode. Characterized by physical spasms
column21: goofy facial expressions
column22: and stopping speech in mid-sentence.

The other day I went to the local religious book store where I saw a "HONK IF
YOU LOVE JESUS" bumper sticker. I bought it and put it on my back bumper and I''m
glad I did.

What an uplifting experience followed. That bumper sticker really worked!!

I found lots of people who loved Jesus.

I was stopped at the light at a busy intersection
column2:
just lost in thought about
the Lord. Why
column3:
the guy behind me started to honk like crazy.

\n

He must REALLY love Jesus because pretty soon he leaned out of his window and
yelled "JESUS CHRIST!" as loud as he could.

\n

It was like a football game with him shouting
column4:
"GO!...JESUS CHRIST!...GO!"
Everyone else started honking too
column5:
so I leaned out the window and smiled and
waved to all those loving people.

There must have been a guy from Florida back there because I heard him yell
something about a sunny beach and saw him waving with only his middle finger.

I asked my kids what he meant by that and they laughed and said it was the
Hawaiian good luck sign. So I leaned out of the window and gave him the good
luck sign back.

A couple of people were so caught up in the joy of the moment that they got
out of their cars and started running towards me!

I bet they wanted to pray
column6:
but just then I noticed that the light had changed
so I stepped on the gas.

It''s a good thing that I did because I was the only driver to get across the
intersection.

I looked back and everyone was still standing there so I leaned way out the
window and held up the Hawaiian good luck sign as I drove away.

Praise the Lord for such wonderful people!

column1:
I.
Know that although the cat has the advantage of quickness and lack of concern
for human life
column2:
you have the advantage of strength. Capitalize on that advantage
by selecting the battlefield. Don''t try to bathe him in an open area where he
can force you to chase him. Pick a very small bathroom. If your bathroom is more
than four feet square
column3:
I recommend that you get in the tub with the cat and
close the sliding -glass doors as if you were about to take a shower. (A simple
shower curtain will not do. A berserk cat can shred a three-ply rubber shower
curtain quicker than a politician can shift positions.)
II.
Know that a cat has claws and will not hesitate to remove all the skin from
your body. Your advantage here is that you are smart and know how to dress to
protect yourself. I recommend canvas overalls tucked into high-top construction
boots
column4: a pair of steel-mesh gloves
column5: an army helmet
column6: a hockey face-mask
column7:
and a
long-sleeved flak jacket.

\n

III.
Use the element of surprise. Pick up your cat nonchalantly
column8:
as if to simply
carry him to his supper dish. (Cats will not usually notice your strange attire.
They have little or no interest in fashion as a rule.)

\n

IV.
. Once you are inside the bathroom
column9:
speed is essential to survival. In a
single liquid motion
column10: shut the bathroom door
column11: step into the tub enclosure
column12:
slide
the glass door shut
column13:
dip the cat in the water and squirt him with shampoo. You
have begun one of the wildest 45 seconds of your life.

\n

V.
Cats have no handles. Add the fact that he now has soapy fur
column14:
and the problem
is radically compounded. Do not expect to hold on to him for more than two or
three seconds at a time. When you have him
column15: however
column16:
you must remember to give
him another squirt of shampoo and rub like crazy. He''ll then spring free and
fall back into the water
column17:
thereby rinsing himself off. (The national record for
cats is three latherings
column18:
so don''t expect too much.)

\n

IV.
Next
column19:
the cat must be dried. Novice cat bathers always assume this part will
be the most difficult
column20:
for humans generally are worn out at this point and the
cat is just getting really determined. In fact
column21:
the drying is simple compared
with what you have just been through. That''s because by now the cat is
semi-permanently affixed to your right leg. You simply pop the drain plug with
your foot
column22: reach for your towel and wait. (Occasionally
column23: however
column24:
the cat will
end up clinging to the top of your army helmet. If this happens
column25:
the best thing
you can do is to shake him loose and to encourage him toward your leg.) After
all the water is drained from the tub
column26:
it is a simple matter to just reach down
and dry the cat. In a few days the cat will relax enough to be removed from your
leg. He will usually have nothing to say for about three weeks and will spend a
lot of time sitting with his back to you. He might even become psychoceramic and
develop the fixed stare of a plaster figurine. You will be tempted to assume he
is angry. This isn''t usually the case. As a rule he is simply plotting ways to
get through your defenses and injure you for life the next time you decide to
give him a bath. But at least now he smells a lot better

column1: �酶惟If you receive a message with a subject line of "Bad times
column2:
delete it
immediately WITHOUT reading it. This is the most dangerous virus yet.
�酶惟It will re-write your hard drive. Not only that, but it will scramble any
disks that are even close to your computer (20'' range at 72 degrees Fahrenheit).

\n

�酶惟It will recalibrate your refrigerator''s coolness setting so all your ice
cream melts and milk curdles.
�酶惟It will demagnetize the strips on all your credit cards, reprogram your ATM
access code, and screw up the tracking on your VCR and use subspace field
harmonics to scratch any CDs you try to play.
�酶惟It will program your phone autodial to call only your mother-in-law''s number.

\n

�酶惟It will hide your car keys when you are late for work and interfere with your
car radio so that you hear 1940''s hits and static while stuck in traffic.
�酶惟It will give you nightmares about circus clowns. It will replace your shampoo
with Nair and your Nair with Rogaine, all while changing all your active verbs
to passive tense and incorporating undetectable misspellings which grossly
change the interpretation of key sentences.
�酶惟Bad times" will give you Dutch Elm disease.
�酶惟It will rewrite your back-up files

hairdryer plugged in dangerously close to a full bathtub.
�酶惟It will not only remove the forbidden tags from your mattresses and pillows
column4:
but also refill your skim milk with whole.
�酶惟It is insidious and subtle. It is dangerous and terrifying to behold. It is
also a rather interesting shade of mauve.
�酶惟These are just a few signs. Be very

column1: SEATTLE''S TURKEY DAY ETIQUETTE It''s been 145 years since the first white settlers landed at Alki Beach at Thanksgiving time
column2: took one look at the overcast skies and the sodden
column3: rain-soaked West Seattle terrain
column4: and burst into tears.(History
column5: alas
column6: doesn''t record the response of the Native Americans when they spotted those tear-drenched settlers. But they probably were too polite to laugh out loud.)In the intervening years
column7: the first residents and the settlers have worked out the rules for Thanksgiving
column8: Puget Sound style. Here they are
column9: recently updated by an ad hoc Turkey Day committee:DRESS CODE. Thanksgiving Day guests will arrive wearing Seattle tuxes: clean jeans
column10: turtleneck sweaters and down jackets with weathered ski-lift tags. Hiking boots are optional.CONVERSATION''S GAMBIT. Topics will include: 1) the election; 2) previous elections; and
column11: 3) the next election. Several arguments will ensue before the host or hostess declares politics ''off-limits.''CLEANERS'' COROLLARY. Spills will happen in direct proportion to the staining capacity of the dish (cranberry sauce rates high) and the expense of dry cleaning the garment.CHRISTMAS CONVENTION. If you are attending a family gathering
column12: expect this reminder: ''Don''t forget to bring your Christmas list to Thanksgiving dinner.''MEOW''S MOMENT. The family cat will appear long enough to 1) shed hair on anyone wearing a black or navy-blue sweater; 2) perch on the lap of whoever most dislikes cats; and
column13: 3) insist on sharing the smoked-salmon hors d''oeuvres.OLD-TIMERS'' LAMENT. Some oldster in the group will remark that it''s a rotten shame there''s no longer a Turkey Day football game between Puget Sound and Seattle high-school champs.ELBOW''S LAW. Local custom calls for every left-handed diner to be seated to the right of a right-handed diner
column14: maximizing chances for spills.PORCELAIN''S PROGRESS. At least two different patterns of dinnerware must be visible on Puget Sound tables during every course.SALAD LAW. Tossed salads supplied by guests will arrive with an excess of moisture
column15: supplied by ambient rainfall.  If the day is merely overcast
column16: the host or hostess should add water before serving.MOLDED SALAD LAW. Guaranteed to do one of three things: contain miniature marshmallows
column17: fail to unmold properly
column18: or slide off the serving plate onto the lap of one of the diners.GRAVY''S CONSTANT. The silver gravy boat -- a wedding present from Great Aunt Emma and Uncle Ed -- will vanish before the meal. It will show up next summer when you''re searching for beach towels.TURKEY''S GRIPE. One vegetarian guest will complain about the fare
column19: saying
column20: ''Why can''t we ever have tofu au gratin?''PIE''S PARADOX. Provide two kinds of pie and diners will either decline or ask for ''a sliver of both.''POLLYANNA''S PRINCIPLE. Guests will include one orphan
column21: someone from out of town who can''t make it home. If no orphan is available
column22: the family oddball can substitute.REFRIGERATOR''S RULE. After all guests depart
column23: at least one never-served dish will turn up in the refrigerator.DEPARTURE''S RULE. Some guests will arrive very early; some will show up late. But they''ll all leave at the same time.

column1: Little Johnny was 12 years old and
column2: like other boys his age
column3:
was rather
curious. He had been hearing quite a bit about "courting" from older boys and he
wondered what it was like and how it was done. One day he took his question to
his mother who became rather flustered. Instead of explaining things to Johnny
column4:
his mother told him to hide behind the curtains one night and watch his older
sister and her boyfriend. This he did. The following morning
column5:
Johnny described
everything to his mom. "Sis and her boyfriend sat and talked for awhile then he
turned off most of the lights. He then started hugging and kissing her. I
figured Sis must be getting sick because her face started to look funny. He must
have thought so too because he put his hand inside her blouse to feel her heart
just like the doctor would do. He was not as smart as a doctor because he seemed
to be having trouble finding it. "I guess he was getting sick too because pretty
soon both of them started panting and getting all out of breath. His other hand
must have been cold because he put it in her skirt. About this time Sis got
worse and began to moan and groan and squirm around and slide down towards the
end of the couch. This is when the fever started. "I knew it was the fever
because Sis said she felt real hot. Finally I found out what was making them so
sick. A big eel had gotten inside his pants somehow. It just jumped out of his
pants and stood there
column6: about 10 inches long
column7: honest. Anyway
column8:
he grabbed it in
one hand to keep it from getting away. "When Sis saw it
column9: she got real scared
column10:
her eyes got big and her mouth fell open and started calling to God and stuff.
She said it was the biggest one she ever saw...... I should have told her about
the one down at the lake. "Sis got brave and tried to kill the eel by biting its
head off. All of a sudden she made a noise and let the eel go. I guess it bit
her back. Then she grabbed it with both hands and held it tight while her
boyfriend took a muzzle out of his pocket and slipped it over the eel`s head to
keep it from biting again. "Sis lay back and spread her legs so she could get a
scissor lock on it and he helped by laying on top of the eel. The eel put up a
hell of a fight. Sis started groaning and squealing and her boyfriend almost
upset the couch. I guess he wanted to kill it by squeezing it between them.
"After a while they both quit moving and a great sigh came forth. Her boyfriend
got up
column11: and sure enough
column12:
the eel was dead. I knew it was dead because it just
hung there limp with some of its insides hanging out. "Sis and her boyfriend
were a little tired from the battle but they went on courting anyways. He
started hugging and kissing her again. By golly the eel wasn`t dead after all.
It jumped straight up and started to fight again. I guess eels are like cats
with 9-lives. "This time Sis jumped up and tried to kill the eel by sitting on
it. After 35 minutes of struggling
column13:
they finally killed it. I knew it was dead
because I saw Sis`s boyfriend peel its skin off and flush it down the
toilet....."

column6:

column1:
This blonde is driving down an old country road when she spots another blonde in a wheat field rowing a boat.

\n

She pulls over to the side of the road and stops the car. Staring in disbelief
column2:
she stands at the side of the road to watch the woman for a while.

\n

When she can''t stand it any more
column3: she calls out to the blonde in the field
column4:
''Why are you rowing a boat in the middle of the field?''

\n

The blonde in the field stops rowing and responds
column5:
''Because it is an ocean of wheat.''

\n

The blonde standing at the side of the road is furious. She yells at the blonde in the field
column6:
''It is dumb blondes like you that give the rest of us a bad name.''

The blonde in the field just shrugs her shoulders and begins rowing again.

The blonde on the side of the road is beside herself and shakes her fist at the blonde in the field yelling
column7: ''If I could swim
column8: I would come out there and kick your arse.''

column1: Some more terms for the  TECHNO OFFICE DICTIONARYPerot   To quit unexpectedly
column2: as in    ''My cellular phone just perot''ed.''CLM (Career-Limiting Move)   Used among microserfs to describe an ill-advised activity.    Trashing your boss while he or she is within earshot is a serious CLM. Treeware   Hacker slang for documentation or other printed material.Dead Tree Edition   The paper version of a publication available in both paper and electronic   forms
column3: as in: ''The dead tree edition of the San Francisco Chronicle...'' Dilberted   To be exploited and oppressed by your boss. Derived from the experiences   of Dilbert
column4: the geek-in-hell comic strip character. ''I''ve been dilberted   again.  The old man revised the specs for the fourth time this week.'' World Wide Wait   The real meaning of WWW.CGI Joe   A hard-core CGI script programmer with all the social skills and charisma   of a plastic action figure. Dorito Syndrome   Feelings of emptiness and dissatisfaction triggered by addictive   substances that lack nutritional content. ''I just spent six hours surfing   the Web
column5: and now I''ve got a bad case of Dorito Syndrome.'' Under Mouse Arrest   Getting busted for violating an on-line service''s rule of conduct. ''Sorry   I couldn''t get back to you. AOL put me under mouse arrest.'' Glazing   Corporate-speak for sleeping with your eyes open. A popular pastime at   conferences and early-morning meetings. ''Didn''t he notice that half the   room was glazing by the second session?'' Graybar Land   The place you go while you''re staring at a computer that''s processing   something very slowly (while you watch the gray bar creep across the   screen). ''I was in graybar land for what seemed like hours
column6: thanks to that   CAD rendering.'' Open-Collar Workers   People who work at home or telecommute.Squirt The Bird   To transmit a signal up to a satellite. ''Crew and talent are ready...    what time do we squirt the bird?'' Cobweb Site   A World Wide Web Site that hasn''t been updated for a long time.    A dead web page. It''s a Feature   From the adage ''It''s not a bug
column7: it''s a feature.'' Used sarcastically to   describe an unpleasant experience that you wish to gloss over. Keyboard Plaque   The disgusting buildup of dirt and crud found on computer keyboards.    ''Are there any other terminals I can use? This one has a bad case of    keyboard plaque.'' Adminisphere   The rarefied organizational layers beginning just above the rank and file.    Decisions that fall from the adminisphere are often profoundly   inappropriate or irrelevant to the problems they were designed to solve. Gray Matter   Older
column8: experienced business people hired by young entrepreneurial firms   looking to appear more reputable and established. Salmon Day   The experience of spending an entire day swimming upstream only to get   screwed in the end. 404   Someone who is clueless
column9: from the World Wide Web error message
column10: ''404 Not Found''
column11: meaning the requested document couldn''t be located.    ''Don''t bother asking him
column12: he''s 404''. 411   Information
column13: to provide information
column14: or to point someone in the right   direction.  From the telephone number to phone company information lines.   ''Thanks for the 411''

column1: A man recently bought a bull elephant for 50 grand. He decided to make big bucks out of the elephant. He trained the elephant not to jump no matter what then he set up a challenge to make the elephant jump. The prize money was 10 grand. To play this game
column2: the challenger must pay 1 grand to the guy before playing. Lots of people came and tried all sorts of tricks to make the elephant jump but without success. Until the a guy show up and decided to take up this challenge. He paid the elephant owner 1 grand and went to his car and took out a golf club. He held the club behind him and walked around the elephant. After walking around the elephant a few times
column3: he stopped right behind the elephant. He raised his club and swung as hard as he could right smack between the elephant''s hind legs. Being a bull elephant
column4: it leaped twenty feet into the air and landed with a crash. The elephant owner
column5: disgusted with the elephant''s performance
column6: paid the guy with the golf club his 10 k. After that
column7: the elephant owner decided to create another challenge. The prize money was now double but so was fee required to pay. This time
column8: the challenge was to make the elephant shake it''s head. Again
column9: lots of people came to make the elephant shake it''s head and they all failed until the same guy with the golf club came again. He paid the elephant owner 2 grand and once again took out his golf club. Once again
column10: the guy with the golf club walked aroung the elephant. This time
column11: he stopped in front of the elephant. "Hello." The guy said. "Remember me?" The elephant nodded. "Remember this golf club?" The guy asked
column12: showing the elephant his glof club. The elephant nodded. "Remember what I did to you the last time?" The elephant nodded nervously. Then the guy said "DO YOU WANT ME TO DO IT AGAIN?!"

column1:
Subject: a day at the gym

\n

Dear Diary
column2:
\n

For my forty fifth birthday this year
column3:
my wife (the dear) purchased a week of personal training at the local health club for me.

\n

Although I am still in great shape since playing on my college football team 20 yrs ago
column4:
I decided it would be a good idea to go ahead and give it a try.

\n

I called the club and made my reservation with a personal trainer named Belinda
column5:
who identified herself as a 26 yr old aerobics instructor and model for athletic clothing and swimwear.

My wife seemed pleased with my enthusiasm to get started! The club encouraged me to keep a diary to chart my progress.

MONDAY:

Started my day at 6:00am.

Tough to get out of bed
column6: but it was well worth it when I arrived at the health club to find Belinda waiting for me. She was something of a Greek goddess - with blonde hair
column7:
dancing eyes and a dazzling white smile. Woo Hoo!!!!!

\n

Belinda gave me a tour and showed me the machines. She took my pulse after 5 minutes on the treadmill. She was alarmed that my pulse was so fast
column8:
but I attributed it to standing next to her in her Lycra aerobics outfit.

\n

I enjoyed watching the skillful way in which she conducted her aerobics class after my workout today. Very inspiring
column9: Belinda was encouraging as I did my sit-ups
column10:
l though my gut was already aching from holding it in the whole time she was around.

This is going to be a FANTASTIC week!!

TUESDAY:

I drank a whole pot of coffee
column11: but I finally made it out the door. Belinda made me lie on my back and push a heavy iron bar into the air
column12: and then she put weights on it! My legs were a little wobbly on the treadmill
column13:
but I made the full mile. Belinda''s rewarding smile made it all worthwhile.

I feel GREAT!! It ''s a whole new life for me.

WEDNESDAY:

The only way I can brush my teeth is by lying on the toothbrush on the counter and moving my mouth back and forth over it. I believe I have a hernia in both pectorals. Driving was OK as long as I didn�酶惟t try to steer or stop. I parked on top of a GEO in the club parking lot.

Belinda was impatient with me
column14: insisting that my screams bothered other club members.  Her voice is a little too perky for early in the morning and when she scolds
column15:
she gets this nasally whine that is VERY annoying.

\n

My chest hurts when I got on the treadmill
column16:
so Belinda put me on the stair monster. Why the hell would anyone invent a machine to simulate an activity rendered obsolete by elevators?

Belinda told me it would help me get in shape and enjoy life. She said some other shit too.

THURSDAY:

Belinda was waiting for me with her vampire-like teeth exposed as her thin
column17:
cruel lips were pulled back in a full snarl. I couldn''t help being a half an hour late; it took me that long to tie my shoes.

\n

Belinda took me to work out with dumbbells. When she was not looking
column18: I ran and hid in the men''s room. She sent Lars to find me
column19: then
column20: as punishment
column21:
put me on the rowing machine - which I sank.

\n

FRIDAY:

\n

I hate that bitch Belinda more than any human being has ever hated any other human being in the history of the world. Stupid
column22: skinny
column23:
anemic little cheerleader.

\n

If there were a part of my body I could move without unbearable pain
column24:
I would beat her with it. Belinda wanted me to work on my triceps. I
don''t have any triceps! And if you don''t want dents in the floor
column25:
don''t hand me the *&%#(#&**!!@*@. Barbells or anything that weighs more than a sandwich. (Which I am sure you learned in the sadistic school you attended
and graduated magna cumlaude from.)

\n

The treadmill flung me off and I landed on a health and nutrition teacher. Why couldn�酶惟t it have been someone softer
column26:
like the drama coach or the choir director?

\n

SATURDAY:

\n

Belinda left a message on my answering machine in her grating
column27: shrilly voice wondering why I did not show up today. Just hearing her made me want to smash the machine with my planner. However
column28:
I lacked the strength to even
use the TV remote and ended up catching eleven straight hours of the Weather Channel.

\n

SUNDAY:

\n

I''m having the Church van pick me up for services today so I can go and thank GOD that this week is over. I will also pray that next year
column29: my wife (the bitch)
column30:
will choose a gift for me that is fun - like a root canal or a vasectomy.

\n

column1:
Subject: a day at the gym

\n

Dear Diary
column2:
\n

For my forty fifth birthday this year
column3:
my wife (the dear) purchased a week of personal training at the local health club for me.

\n

Although I am still in great shape since playing on my college football team 20 yrs ago
column4:
I decided it would be a good idea to go ahead and give it a try.

\n

I called the club and made my reservation with a personal trainer named Belinda
column5:
who identified herself as a 26 yr old aerobics instructor and model for athletic clothing and swimwear.

My wife seemed pleased with my enthusiasm to get started! The club encouraged me to keep a diary to chart my progress.

MONDAY:

Started my day at 6:00am.

Tough to get out of bed
column6: but it was well worth it when I arrived at the health club to find Belinda waiting for me. She was something of a Greek goddess - with blonde hair
column7:
dancing eyes and a dazzling white smile. Woo Hoo!!!!!

\n

Belinda gave me a tour and showed me the machines. She took my pulse after 5 minutes on the treadmill. She was alarmed that my pulse was so fast
column8:
but I attributed it to standing next to her in her Lycra aerobics outfit.

\n

I enjoyed watching the skillful way in which she conducted her aerobics class after my workout today. Very inspiring
column9: Belinda was encouraging as I did my sit-ups
column10:
l though my gut was already aching from holding it in the whole time she was around.

This is going to be a FANTASTIC week!!

TUESDAY:

I drank a whole pot of coffee
column11: but I finally made it out the door. Belinda made me lie on my back and push a heavy iron bar into the air
column12: and then she put weights on it! My legs were a little wobbly on the treadmill
column13:
but I made the full mile. Belinda''s rewarding smile made it all worthwhile.

I feel GREAT!! It ''s a whole new life for me.

WEDNESDAY:

The only way I can brush my teeth is by lying on the toothbrush on the counter and moving my mouth back and forth over it. I believe I have a hernia in both pectorals. Driving was OK as long as I didn�酶惟t try to steer or stop. I parked on top of a GEO in the club parking lot.

Belinda was impatient with me
column14: insisting that my screams bothered other club members.  Her voice is a little too perky for early in the morning and when she scolds
column15:
she gets this nasally whine that is VERY annoying.

\n

My chest hurts when I got on the treadmill
column16:
so Belinda put me on the stair monster. Why the hell would anyone invent a machine to simulate an activity rendered obsolete by elevators?

Belinda told me it would help me get in shape and enjoy life. She said some other shit too.

column1: This 85 year old couple
column2: having been married almost 60 years
column3: had died in a car crash. They had been in good health the last ten years mainly due to her interest in health food
column4: and exercise. When they reached the pearly gates
column5:
St. Peter took them to their mansion which was decked out with a beautiful kitchen and master bath suite and Jacuzzi.

\n

As they "oohed and aahed" the old man asked Peter how much all this was going to cost.

\n

"It''s free
column6:
Peter replied, this is Heaven."

\n

Next they went out back to survey the championship golf course that the home backed up to. They would have golfing privileges everyday and each week the course changed to a new one representing the great golf courses on earth.

\n

The old man asked
column7:
"what are the green fees?".

\n

Peter''s reply
column8: "This is heaven
column9:
you play for free."

\n

Next they went to the club house and saw the lavish buffet lunch with the cuisine''s of the world laid out. "How much to eat?" asked the old man.

\n

"Don''t you understand yet? This is heaven
column10:
it is free!" Peter replied with some exasperation.

\n

"Well
column11:
where are the low fat and low cholesterol tables?" the old man asked timidly.

\n

Peter lectured
column12:
"That''s the best part...you can eat as much as you like of whatever you like and you never get fat and you never get sick. This is Heaven."

\n

With that the old man went into a fit of anger
column13: throwing down his hat and stomping on it
column14: and shrieking wildly. Peter and his wife both tried to calm him down
column15:
asking him what was wrong.

\n

The old man looked at his wife and said
column16: "This is all your fault. If it weren''t for your bran muffins
column17: I could have been here ten years ago!"

column1:
The 5 questions most feared by men are:
1...What are you thinking about?
2...Do you love me?
3...Do I look fat?
4...Do you think she is prettier than me?
5...What would you do if I died?

\n

What makes these questions so difficult is that every one is guaranteed to explode into a major argument if the man answers incorrectly(i.e.
column2:
tells the truth).

\n

As a public service
column3: each question is analyzed below
column4:
along with possible Responses.

\n

Question # 1: What are you thinking about?

\n

The proper answer to this
column5: of course
column6: is: "I''m sorry if I''ve been pensive
column7: dear. I was just reflecting on what a warm
column8: wonderful
column9: thoughtful
column10: caring
column11: intelligent woman you are
column12:
and how lucky I am to have met you."
This response obviously bears no resemblance to the true answer
column13:
which most likely is one of the following:
a...Baseball.
b...Football.
c...How fat you are.
d...How much prettier she is than you.
e...How I would spend the insurance money if you died.

\n

Perhaps the best response to this question was offered by Al Bundy
column14: who once told Peg
column15: "If I wanted you to know what I was thinking
column16:
I would be talking to you!"

\n

Question # 2: Do you love me?

\n

The proper response is: "YES!" or
column17: if you feel a more detailed  answer is in order
column18: "Yes
column19:
dear." Inappropriate responses include:
a...Oh Yeah
column20:
crap loads.
b...Would it make you feel better if I said yes?
c...That depends on what you mean by love.
d...Does it matter?
e...Who
column21:
me?

\n

Question # 3: Do I look fat?

\n

The correct answer is an emphatic: "Of course not!"
Among the incorrect answers are:
a...Compared to what?
b...I wouldn''t call you fat
column22:
but you''re not exactly thin.
c...A little extra weight looks good on you.
d...I''ve seen fatter.
e...Could you repeat the question? I was just thinking about how I would spend the insurance money if you died.

\n

Question # 4: Do you think she''s prettier than me?

\n

Once again
column23:
the proper response is an emphatic: "Of course not!"
Incorrect responses include:

\n

a...Yes
column24:
but you have a better personality.
b...Not prettier
column25:
but definitely thinner.
c...Not as pretty as you when you were her age.
d...Define pretty.
e...Could you repeat the question? I was just thinking about how I would spend the insurance money if you died.

\n

Question # 5: What would you do if I died?

\n

A definite no-win question.(The real answer
column26: of course
column27:
is "Buy a Corvette and a Boat").
WARNING: No matter how you answer this
column28: be prepared for at least an hour of follow-up questions
column29:
usually along the these lines:

\n

WOMAN: Would you get married again?
MAN: Definitely not!
WOMAN: Why not-don''t you like being married?
MAN: Of course I do.
WOMAN: Then why wouldn''t you remarry?
MAN: Okay
column30:
I''d get married again.
WOMAN: You would? (with a hurtful look on her face)
WOMAN: Would you sleep with her in our bed?
MAN: Where else would we sleep?
WOMAN: Would you put away my pictures
column31:
and replace them with pictures of her?
MAN: That would seem like the proper thing to do.
WOMAN: And would you let her use my golf clubs?
MAN: She can''t use them; she''s left-handed
WOMAN: - - - silence - - -
MAN: Oh ( expletive deleted).

A women desperately looking for work goes into a toy factory.

\n

The Personnel Manager goes over her resume and explains to her that he regrets
he has nothing worthy of her. The woman answers that she really needs work and
will take almost anything. The Personnel Manager hems and haws and finally says
he does have a low skill job on the Tickle-Me-Elmo line and nothing else. The
woman happily accepts. He takes her down to the line and explains her duties and
that she should come in at 8am the next day.

\n

The next day at 8:45 there''s a knock at the Personnel Manager''s door. The
Tickle-Me-Elmo line manager comes in and starts ranting about the woman just
hired. After screaming for 15 minutes about how badly backed up the assembly
line is
column2:
the Personnel Manager suggested he be shown the problem.

\n

Together they head down to the line and sure enough Elmos are backed up from
here to kingdom come. Right at the end of the line is the woman just hired. She
has pulled over a roll of the material used for the Elmos and has a big bag of
marbles. They both watch as she cuts a little piece of fabric and take 2 marbles
and starts sewing them between Elmo''s legs.

\n

The Personnel Manager starts to kill himself laughing and finally after 20
minutes of rolling around
column3:
he pulls himself together and walks over to the new
employee and says
column4: "I''m sorry
column5:
I guess you misunderstood me yesterday. What I
wanted you to do was give Elmo two test tickles."

column1: A young man
column2: who worked at a driving range
column3: picked up a couple of dozen old balls one day and took them home with him
column4:
stuffing them into his pants pockets.
On the bus on his way home
column5: an elderly old lady sat down next to him
column6: so he had to scrunch them up to make room for her. He noticed after a while the lady was glancing sideways toward his pockets. A bit embarrassed
column7: he said to the lady
column8: "It`s all right ma`am
column9:
they`re just golf balls."

\n

She nodded and smiled sympathetically and a few moments later said
column10: "Tell me - is that something like tennis elbow?"

column1:
You know you''re out of college when...

\n

1. Your salary is less than your tuition.
2. Your potted plants stay alive.
3. Shacking in a twin-sized bed seems absurd.
4. You keep more food than beer in the fridge.
5. You have to pay your own credit card bill.
6. Mac & Cheese no longer counts as a well-balanced meal.
7. You haven''t seen a soap opera in over a year.
8. 8:00 am is not early.
9. You have to file your own taxes.
10. You hear your favorite song on the elevator at work.
11. You''re not carded anymore.
12. You carry an umbrella.
13. You learn that bachelor is a nice term for "jackass".
14. "Extended childhood" only really pertains to your salary which is a little less than your allowance used to be. 15 . "Twenty-something" means over-qualified
column2:
under-paid and not married.
16. Your friends marry instead of hook-up and divorce instead of break-up.
17. You start watching the weather channel.
18. Jeans
column3:
flannels and baseball caps aren''t staples in your wardrobe.
19. You can no longer take shots
column4:
and smoking gives you a sinus attack.
20. You go from 130 days of vacation time to 7.
21. You stop confusing 401k plan with 10K run.
22. You go to parties that police don''t raid.
23. Adults feel comfortable telling jokes about sex in front of you...and they''re no longer "adults" - they are your peers.
24. You don''t know what time Wendy''s closes anymore.
25. Your car insurance goes down.
26. You refer to college students as kids.
27. You drink wine
column5: scotch and martinis instead of beer
column6:
bourbon and rum.
28. Your parents start making casual remarks about grandchildren.
29. You feed your dog science diet instead of taco bell.
30. Your idea of a rocking Friday night is scoring one of the new releases at Blockbuster.
31. Half your conversations with current college students start with
column7: "When I was in college..."

An Army Ranger was on vacation in the depths of Louisiana and he wanted a pair
of genuine alligator shoes in the worst way

high prices the local vendors were asking.
After becoming very frustrated with the "no haggle" attitude of one of the
shopkeepers
column3: the Ranger shouted
column4:

alligator so I can get a pair of shoes made at a reasonable price!"
The vendor said
column5: "By all means
column6:
be my guest. Maybe you will run into a couple
of Marines who were in here earlier saying the same thing."
So the Ranger headed into the bayou that same day and a few hours later came
upon two men standing waist deep in the water. He thought
column7:
"those must be the
two Marines the guy in town was talking about." Just then
column8:
the Ranger saw a
tremendously long gator swimming rapidly underwater towards one of the Marines.
Just as the gator was about to attack
column9:
the Marine grabbed its neck with both
hands and strangled it to death with very little effort. Then both Marines
dragged it on shore and flipped it on its back. Laying nearby were several more
of the creatures.
One of the Marines then exclaimed
column10: "Damn
column11:
this one doesn''t have any shoes
either!"

column1:
CAT MIRACLE DIET: Most diets fail because we are still thinking and eating like people. For those us who have never had any success dieting. Well now there is the new Miracle Cat Diet!

\n

Except for cats that eat like people -- such as getting lots of table scraps -- most cats are long and lean (or tiny and petite). the Cat Miracle Diet will help you achieve the same lean
column2: svelte figure. Just follow this diet for one week and you''ll find that you not only look and feel better
column3:
but you will have a whole new outlook on what con- stitutes food. Good Luck!

DAY ONE Breakfast: Open can of expensive gourmet cat food. Any flavor as long as it cost more than .75 per can -- and place 1/4 cup on your plate. Eat 1 bite of food; look around room disdainfully. Knock the rest on the floor. Stare at the wall for awhile before stalking off into the other room.

Lunch: Four blades of grass and one lizard tail. Throw it back up on the cleanest carpet in your house.

Dinner: Catch a moth and play with it until it is almost dead. Eat one wing. Leave the rest to die.

Bedtime snack: Steal one green bean from your spouse''s or partner''s plate. Bat it around the floor until it goes under the refrigerator. Steal one small piece of chicken and eat half of it. Leave the other half on the sofa. Throw out the remaining gourmet cat food from the can you opened this morning.

DAY TWO Breakfast: Picking up the remaining chicken bite from the sofa. Knock it onto the carpet and bat it under the television set. Chew on the corner of the newspaper as your spouse/partner tries to read it.

Lunch: Break into the fresh French bread that you bought as your part of the dinner party on Saturday. Lick the top of it all over. Take one bite out of the middle of the loaf.

Afternoon snack: Catch a large beetle and bring it into the house. Play toss and catch with it until it is mushy and half dead. Allow it to escape under the bed.

Dinner: Open a fresh can of dark-colored gourmet cat food -- tuna or beef works well. Eat it voraciously. Walk from your kitchen to the edge of the living room rug. Promptly throw up on the rug. Step into it as you leave. Track footprints across the entire room.

DAY THREE Breakfast: Drink part of the milk from your spouse''s or partner''s cereal bowl when no one is looking. Splatter part of it on the closest polished aluminum appliance you can find.

Lunch: Catch a small bird and bring it into the house. Play with on top of your down filled comforter. Make sure the bird is seriously injured but not dead before you abandon it for someone else to have to deal with.

Dinner: Beg and cry until you are given some ice cream or milk in a bowl of your own. Take three licks/laps and then turn the bowl over on the floor.

FINAL DAY Breakfast: Eat 6 bugs
column4: any type
column5: being sure to leave a collection of legs
column6: wings
column7:
antennae on the bathroom floor. Drink lots of water. Throw the bugs and all of the water up on your spouse''s or partner''s pillow.

\n

Lunch: Remove the chicken skin from last night''s chicken-to-go leftovers your spouse or partner placed in the trash can. Drag the skin across the floor several times. Chew it in a corner and then abandon.

\n

Dinner: Open another can of expensive gourmet cat food. Select a flavor that is especially runny
column8: like Chicken and Giblets in Gravy. Lick off all the gravy and leave the actual meat to dry and get hard.

find the ball he discovers a witch (hat and all) stirring a
cauldron. So out of curiosity he asks her what she is brewing.

A magic potion" she replies.

"Well what does it for" he asks. "This potion will make anyone an
excellent golfer."

At this he gets really excited and asks if he can have some. She is
agreeable but warns him that it will have dire consequences on his
sex life.

After a short period of soul searching he decides to try the potion.
He goes back to the golf course and completes an excellent game of
golf. Next he challenges the golf pro and beats him easily. He
spends every possible moment of the next year playing golf at every
course he manage to get to and having a wonderful time of it. After
a year he finds himself back at the same course where he found the
witch. Out of curiosity he slices one into the woods so he can talk
to her.

"Well"

column1: When I was in high school I used to be terrified of my girlfriend''s father
column2: who I believe suspected me of wanting to lay hands on his daughter. He would open the door and immediately affect a good-naturedly murderous expression
column3: holding out a handshake that
column4: when gripped
column5:
felt like it could squeeze carbon into diamonds.
Now
column6: years later
column7: it is my turn to be the dad. Remembering how unfairly persecuted I felt when I would pick up my dates
column8:
I do my best to make my daughter''s suitors feel even worse. My motto: wilt them in the living room and they''ll stay wilted all night.
"So
column9: I''ll call out jovially. I see you have your nose pierced. Is that because you''re stupid
column10:
or did you merely want to APPEAR stupid?"
As a dad
column11: I have some basic rules
column12:
which I have carved into two stone tablets that I have on display in my living room.
Rule One: If you pull into my driveway and honk you''d better be delivering a package
column13:
because you''re certainly not picking anything up.
Rule Two: You do not touch my daughter in front of me. You may glance at her
column14: so long as you do not peer at anything below her neck. If you cannot keep your eyes or hands off of my daughter
column15:
I will remove them.
Rule Three: I am aware that it is considered fashionable for boys of your age to wear their trousers so loosely that they appear to be falling off their hips. Please don''t take this as an insult
column16: but you and all of your friends are complete idiots. Still
column17: I want to be fair and open minded about this issue
column18: so I propose this compromise: You may come to the door with your underwear showing and your pants ten sizes too big
column19: and I will not object. However
column20: In order to assure that your clothes do not
column21: in fact
column22: come off during the course of your date with my daughter
column23:
I will take my electric staple gun and fasten your trousers securely in place around your waist.
Rule Four: I''m sure you''ve been told that in today''s world
column24: sex without utilizing a "barrier method" of some kind can kill you. Let me elaborate: when it comes to sex
column25: I am the barrier
column26:
and I WILL kill you.
Rule Five: In order for us to get to know each other
column27: we should talk about sports
column28: politics
column29: and other issues of the day. Please do not do This. The only information I require from you is an indication of when you expect to have my daughter safely back at my house
column30:
and the only word I need from you on this subject is "early."
Rule Six: I have no doubt you are a popular fellow
column31: with many opportunities to date other girls. This is fine with me as long as it is okay with my daughter. Otherwise
column32: once you have gone out with my little girl
column33: you will continue to date no one but her until she is finished with you. If you make her cry
column34:
I will make YOU cry.
Rule Seven: As you stand in my front hallway
column35: waiting for my daughter to appear
column36: and more than an hour goes by
column37: do not sigh and fidget. If you want to be on time for the movie
column38: you should not be dating. My daughter is putting on her makeup
column39: a process which can take longer than painting the Golden Gate Bridge. Instead of just standing there
column40: why don''t you do something useful
column41:
like changing the oil in my car?
Rule Eight: The following places are not appropriate for a date with my daughter: Places where there are beds
column42: sofas
column43: or anything softer than a wooden stool. Places where there are no parents
column44: policemen
column45: or nuns within eyesight. Places where there is darkness. Places where there is dancing
column46: holding hands
column47: or happiness. Places where the ambient temperature is warm enough to induce my daughter to wear shorts
column48: tank tops
column49: midriff T-shirts
column50: or anything other than overalls
column51: a sweater
column52:
and a goose down parka zipped up to her chin. Movies with a strong romantic or sexual theme are to be avoided; movies which feature chainsaws are okay. Hockey games are okay.
My daughter claims it embarrasses her to come downstairs and find me attempting to get her date to recite these eight simple rules from memory. I''d be embarrassed too--there are only eight of them
column54: for the record
column55: I did NOT suggest to one of these cretins that I''d have these rules tattooed on his arm if he couldn''t remember them. (I checked into it
column56:
and the cost is prohibitive.) I merely told him that I thought writing the rules on his arm with a ball point might be inadequate--ink washes off--and that my wood burning set was probably a better alternative.
One time
column57: when my wife caught me having one of my daughter''s would-be suitors practice pulling into the driveway
column58: get out of the car
column59: and go up to knock on the front door (he had violated rule number one
column60:
so I figured he needed to run through the drill a few dozen times) she asked me why I was being so hard on the boy. "Don''t you remember being that age?" she challenged.
Of course I remember. Why do you think I came up with the eight simple rules?
From The 8 Simple Rules for Dating My Daughter
Copyright 1998 W. Bruce Cameron http://www.wbrucecameron.com

column1:
If men ruled the world would be different

\n

- Nodding and looking at your watch would be deemed an acceptable response to ''I love you.''

\n

- Hallmark would make ''Sorry
column2:
what was your name again?'' cards.

\n

- When your girlfriend really needed to talk to you during the game
column3:
she would appear in a little box in the corner of the screen during half-time.

- Breaking up would be a lot easier. A smack on the bum would pretty much do it.

- Birth control could come in ale or lager.

- The funniest guy in the office would get to be the big boss.

- ''Sorry I''m late
column4: I got hammered last night
column5:
'' would be an acceptable excuse for tardiness.

\n

- It''d be considered harmless fun to gather 30 friends
column6: put on horned helmets
column7:
and go pillage a nearby town.

- Lifeguards could remove citizens from beaches for violating the ''public ugliness'' ordinance.

- Tanks would be far easier to rent.

- Instead of beer belly
column8:
you''d get ''beer biceps''.

\n

- Instead of an expensive engagement ring
column9: you could present your wife-to-be with a giant foam hand that said
column10:
''You''re No. 1.''

- Valentine''s Day would be moved to February 29.

- Cops would be broadcast live and you could phone in advice to the pursuing cops. Or to the crooks.

- The victors in any athletic competition would get to kill and eat the losers.

- The only show opposite Friday Night Football would be Friday Night Football from a Different Camera Angle.

- It would be perfectly legal to steal a sports car
column11:
as long as you returned it the following day with a full tank of petrol.

\n

- Every man would get four real ''Get Out of Jail Free'' cards per year.

\n

- When a cop gave you a ticket
column12: every smart-alec answer you responded with would actually reduce your fine
column13:
as in:

Cop: `You know how fast you were going?''

You: ''All I know is that I was spilling my beer all over the place.''

Cop: ''Nice one. That''s $10 off.''
